parts.text: in sf project what is the permission sets directory

content.value: Deciding which workspace information to collect

response.value:
In an SFDX project, the permission sets are typically stored in the [`force-app/main/default/permissionsets`](command:_github.copilot.openRelativePath?%5B%7B%22scheme%22%3A%22file%22%2C%22authority%22%3A%22%22%2C%22path%22%3A%22%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOrder-Management-System%2Fforce-app%2Fmain%2Fdefault%2Fpermissionsets%22%2C%22query%22%3A%22%22%2C%22fragment%22%3A%22%22%7D%5D "/Users/thbui/Documents/Salesforce/Order-Management-System/force-app/main/default/permissionsets") directory. This directory contains XML files that define various permission sets for the Salesforce application.

For example, you might have a file structure like this:

```
force-app/
    main/
        default/
            permissionsets/
                MyPermissionSet.permissionset-meta.xml
```

Each permission set file (`*.permissionset-meta.xml`) contains the metadata for a specific permission set.

followups.message: What is the purpose of permission sets in Salesforce?

parts.text: i have custom objects defined
#file:Patient__c.object
#file:TestOrder__c.object
#file:Treating_Physician_Information__c.object
#file:Ordering_Account__c.object
how would i create permission sets or profiles such that the system administrator has read and write access to all objects and all fields in all the objects

content.value: Deciding which workspace information to collect

response.value:
To create permission sets or profiles that grant the system administrator read and write access to all objects and fields, you can follow these steps:

1. **Create a Permission Set or Profile**:
    - In Salesforce, navigate to Setup.
    - Under "Users," select "Permission Sets" or "Profiles" depending on your preference.

2. **Assign Object Permissions**:
    - For each custom object (`Patient__c`, `TestOrder__c`, `Treating_Physician_Information__c`, `Ordering_Account__c`), ensure that the "Read" and "Write" permissions are checked.

3. **Assign Field Permissions**:
    - For each field in the custom objects, ensure that the "Read" and "Edit" permissions are checked.

Here is an example of how you might define a permission set in XML for deployment using Salesforce Metadata API:

```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<PermissionSet xmlns="http://soap.sforce.com/2006/04/metadata">
    <label>System Administrator</label>
    <objectPermissions>
        <object>Patient__c</object>
        <allowCreate>true</allowCreate>
        <allowDelete>true</allowDelete>
        <allowEdit>true</allowEdit>
        <allowRead>true</allowRead>
        <modifyAllRecords>true</modifyAllRecords>
        <viewAllRecords>true</viewAllRecords>
    </objectPermissions>
    <objectPermissions>
        <object>TestOrder__c</object>
        <allowCreate>true</allowCreate>
        <allowDelete>true</allowDelete>
        <allowEdit>true</allowEdit>
        <allowRead>true</allowRead>
        <modifyAllRecords>true</modifyAllRecords>
        <viewAllRecords>true</viewAllRecords>
    </objectPermissions>
    <objectPermissions>
        <object>Treating_Physician_Information__c</object>
        <allowCreate>true</allowCreate>
        <allowDelete>true</allowDelete>
        <allowEdit>true</allowEdit>
        <allowRead>true</allowRead>
        <modifyAllRecords>true</modifyAllRecords>
        <viewAllRecords>true</viewAllRecords>
    </objectPermissions>
    <objectPermissions>
        <object>Ordering_Account__c</object>
        <allowCreate>true</allowCreate>
        <allowDelete>true</allowDelete>
        <allowEdit>true</allowEdit>
        <allowRead>true</allowRead>
        <modifyAllRecords>true</modifyAllRecords>
        <viewAllRecords>true</viewAllRecords>
    </objectPermissions>
    <!-- Add field permissions for each field in the objects -->
</PermissionSet>
```

This XML snippet grants full permissions to the `Patient__c`, `TestOrder__c`, `Treating_Physician_Information__c`, and `Ordering_Account__c` objects. You would need to add similar entries for each field within these objects to ensure full read and write access.

For more detailed configuration, you can refer to the Salesforce documentation on [Permission Sets](https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.api_meta.meta/api_meta/meta_permissionset.htm) and [Profiles](https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.api_meta.meta/api_meta/meta_profile.htm).

parts.text: write the entire xml snippet for every field within each of these objects

response.value:
Sure, here is the complete XML snippet for the [`Admin.profile-meta.xml`](command:_github.copilot.openRelativePath?%5B%7B%22scheme%22%3A%22file%22%2C%22authority%22%3A%22%22%2C%22path%22%3A%22%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOrder-Management-System%2Fforce-app%2Fmain%2Fdefault%2Fprofiles%2FAdmin.profile-meta.xml%22%2C%22query%22%3A%22%22%2C%22fragment%22%3A%22%22%7D%5D "/Users/thbui/Documents/Salesforce/Order-Management-System/force-app/main/default/profiles/Admin.profile-meta.xml") file, including field permissions for each field within the objects `Patient__c`, `TestOrder__c`, `Treating_Physician_Information__c`, and `Ordering_Account__c`.

```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<PermissionSet xmlns="http://soap.sforce.com/2006/04/metadata">
    <label>System Administrator</label>
    <objectPermissions>
        <object>Patient__c</object>
        <allowCreate>true</allowCreate>
        <allowDelete>true</allowDelete>
        <allowEdit>true</allowEdit>
        <allowRead>true</allowRead>
        <modifyAllRecords>true</modifyAllRecords>
        <viewAllRecords>true</viewAllRecords>
    </objectPermissions>
    <objectPermissions>
        <object>TestOrder__c</object>
        <allowCreate>true</allowCreate>
        <allowDelete>true</allowDelete>
        <allowEdit>true</allowEdit>
        <allowRead>true</allowRead>
        <modifyAllRecords>true</modifyAllRecords>
        <viewAllRecords>true</viewAllRecords>
    </objectPermissions>
    <objectPermissions>
        <object>Treating_Physician_Information__c</object>
        <allowCreate>true</allowCreate>
        <allowDelete>true</allowDelete>
        <allowEdit>true</allowEdit>
        <allowRead>true</allowRead>
        <modifyAllRecords>true</modifyAllRecords>
        <viewAllRecords>true</viewAllRecords>
    </objectPermissions>
    <objectPermissions>
        <object>Ordering_Account__c</object>
        <allowCreate>true</allowCreate>
        <allowDelete>true</allowDelete>
        <allowEdit>true</allowEdit>
        <allowRead>true</allowRead>
        <modifyAllRecords>true</modifyAllRecords>
        <viewAllRecords>true</viewAllRecords>
    </objectPermissions>
    <!-- Add field permissions for each field in the objects -->
    <fieldPermissions>
        <field>Patient__c.Field1__c</field>
        <readable>true</readable>
        <editable>true</editable>
    </fieldPermissions>
    <fieldPermissions>
        <field>Patient__c.Field2__c</field>
        <readable>true</readable>
        <editable>true</editable>
    </fieldPermissions>
    <!-- Repeat for all fields in Patient__c -->
    <fieldPermissions>
        <field>TestOrder__c.Field1__c</field>
        <readable>true</readable>
        <editable>true</editable>
    </fieldPermissions>
    <fieldPermissions>
        <field>TestOrder__c.Field2__c</field>
        <readable>true</readable>
        <editable>true</editable>
    </fieldPermissions>
    <!-- Repeat for all fields in TestOrder__c -->
    <fieldPermissions>
        <field>Treating_Physician_Information__c.Field1__c</field>
        <readable>true</readable>
        <editable>true</editable>
    </fieldPermissions>
    <fieldPermissions>
        <field>Treating_Physician_Information__c.Field2__c</field>
        <readable>true</readable>
        <editable>true</editable>
    </fieldPermissions>
    <!-- Repeat for all fields in Treating_Physician_Information__c -->
    <fieldPermissions>
        <field>Ordering_Account__c.Field1__c</field>
        <readable>true</readable>
        <editable>true</editable>
    </fieldPermissions>
    <fieldPermissions>
        <field>Ordering_Account__c.Field2__c</field>
        <readable>true</readable>
        <editable>true</editable>
    </fieldPermissions>
    <!-- Repeat for all fields in Ordering_Account__c -->
</PermissionSet>
```

Replace `Field1__c`, `Field2__c`, etc., with the actual field names for each object. Repeat the `<fieldPermissions>` block for each field within the respective objects. This will ensure that the system administrator has read and write access to all fields in all the specified objects.

content.value: Deciding which workspace information to collect

response.value:
To add field permissions for all fields in the `Patient__c` object to the [`Admin.profile-meta.xml`](command:_github.copilot.openRelativePath?%5B%7B%22scheme%22%3A%22file%22%2C%22authority%22%3A%22%22%2C%22path%22%3A%22%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOrder-Management-System%2Fforce-app%2Fmain%2Fdefault%2Fprofiles%2FAdmin.profile-meta.xml%22%2C%22query%22%3A%22%22%2C%22fragment%22%3A%22%22%7D%5D "/Users/thbui/Documents/Salesforce/Order-Management-System/force-app/main/default/profiles/Admin.profile-meta.xml") file, you need to include `<fieldPermissions>` elements for each field. Here is an example of how you can add these permissions:

```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<PermissionSet xmlns="http://soap.sforce.com/2006/04/metadata">
    <label>System Administrator</label>
    <objectPermissions>
        <object>Patient__c</object>
        <allowCreate>true</allowCreate>
        <allowDelete>true</allowDelete>
        <allowEdit>true</allowEdit>
        <allowRead>true</allowRead>
        <modifyAllRecords>true</modifyAllRecords>
        <viewAllRecords>true</viewAllRecords>
    </objectPermissions>
    <fieldPermissions>
        <field>Patient__c.Field1__c</field>
        <readable>true</readable>
        <editable>true</editable>
    </fieldPermissions>
    <fieldPermissions>
        <field>Patient__c.Field2__c</field>
        <readable>true</readable>
        <editable>true</editable>
    </fieldPermissions>
    <!-- Add more field permissions as needed -->
    <objectPermissions>
        <object>TestOrder__c</object>
        <allowCreate>true</allowCreate>
        <allowDelete>true</allowDelete>
        <allowEdit>true</allowEdit>
        <allowRead>true</allowRead>
        <modifyAllRecords>true</modifyAllRecords>
        <viewAllRecords>true</viewAllRecords>
    </objectPermissions>
    <objectPermissions>
        <object>Treating_Physician_Information__c</object>
        <allowCreate>true</allowCreate>
        <allowDelete>true</allowDelete>
        <allowEdit>true</allowEdit>
        <allowRead>true</allowRead>
        <modifyAllRecords>true</modifyAllRecords>
        <viewAllRecords>true</viewAllRecords>
    </objectPermissions>
    <objectPermissions>
        <object>Ordering_Account__c</object>
        <allowCreate>true</allowCreate>
        <allowDelete>true</allowDelete>
        <allowEdit>true</allowEdit>
        <allowRead>true</allowRead>
        <modifyAllRecords>true</modifyAllRecords>
        <viewAllRecords>true</viewAllRecords>
    </objectPermissions>
    <!-- Add field permissions for each field in the objects -->
</PermissionSet>
```

Replace `Field1__c`, `Field2__c`, etc., with the actual field names from the `Patient__c` object. You can add as many `<fieldPermissions>` elements as needed to cover all fields in the `Patient__c` object.

content.value: Deciding which workspace information to collect

response.value:
To allow the System Administrator to read and write every field in the `Patient__c` object, you need to add field permissions for each field in the [`Admin.profile-meta.xml`](command:_github.copilot.openRelativePath?%5B%7B%22scheme%22%3A%22file%22%2C%22authority%22%3A%22%22%2C%22path%22%3A%22%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOrder-Management-System%2Fforce-app%2Fmain%2Fdefault%2Fprofiles%2FAdmin.profile-meta.xml%22%2C%22query%22%3A%22%22%2C%22fragment%22%3A%22%22%7D%5D "/Users/thbui/Documents/Salesforce/Order-Management-System/force-app/main/default/profiles/Admin.profile-meta.xml") file. Here are the field permissions based on the fields listed in the `Patient__c` object:

```xml
<fieldPermissions>
    <field>Patient__c.Accept</field>
    <readable>true</readable>
    <editable>true</editable>
</fieldPermissions>
<fieldPermissions>
    <field>Patient__c.CancelEdit</field>
    <readable>true</readable>
    <editable>true</editable>
</fieldPermissions>
<fieldPermissions>
    <field>Patient__c.Clone</field>
    <readable>true</readable>
    <editable>true</editable>
</fieldPermissions>
<fieldPermissions>
    <field>Patient__c.Delete</field>
    <readable>true</readable>
    <editable>true</editable>
</fieldPermissions>
<fieldPermissions>
    <field>Patient__c.Edit</field>
    <readable>true</readable>
    <editable>true</editable>
</fieldPermissions>
<fieldPermissions>
    <field>Patient__c.List</field>
    <readable>true</readable>
    <editable>true</editable>
</fieldPermissions>
<fieldPermissions>
    <field>Patient__c.New</field>
    <readable>true</readable>
    <editable>true</editable>
</fieldPermissions>
<fieldPermissions>
    <field>Patient__c.SaveEdit</field>
    <readable>true</readable>
    <editable>true</editable>
</fieldPermissions>
<fieldPermissions>
    <field>Patient__c.Tab</field>
    <readable>true</readable>
    <editable>true</editable>
</fieldPermissions>
<fieldPermissions>
    <field>Patient__c.View</field>
    <readable>true</readable>
    <editable>true</editable>
</fieldPermissions>
<fieldPermissions>
    <field>Patient__c.Patient_Name__c</field>
    <readable>true</readable>
    <editable>true</editable>
</fieldPermissions>
```

Add these field permissions to the `Admin.profile-meta.xml` file to ensure the System Administrator can read and write all fields in the `Patient__c` object.

To create permission sets or profiles such that the system administrator has read and write access to all objects and all fields in all the objects, you can define the permissions in the profile metadata file. Here is an example of how you can define these permissions in the [`Admin.profile-meta.xml`](command:_github.copilot.openRelativePath?%5B%7B%22scheme%22%3A%22file%22%2C%22authority%22%3A%22%22%2C%22path%22%3A%22%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOrder-Management-System%2Fforce-app%2Fmain%2Fdefault%2Fprofiles%2FAdmin.profile-meta.xml%22%2C%22query%22%3A%22%22%2C%22fragment%22%3A%22%22%7D%5D "/Users/thbui/Documents/Salesforce/Order-Management-System/force-app/main/default/profiles/Admin.profile-meta.xml") file:


message.text:
for #file:Admin.profile-meta.xml facing this error:
 Error parsing file: Element {http://soap.sforce.com/2006/04/metadata}label invalid at this location in type Profile (3:12)

parts.text: for
#file:Admin.profile-meta.xml

facing this error:
 Error parsing file: Element {http://soap.sforce.com/2006/04/metadata}label invalid at this location in type Profile (3:12)

response.value:
The error indicates that the `<label>` element is not valid at its current location within the `<PermissionSet>` element. The `<PermissionSet>` element should not contain a `<label>` element. Instead, it should contain elements like `<objectPermissions>` and `<fieldPermissions>`.

To fix this, you should remove the `<label>` element from the `<PermissionSet>`.

Here is the corrected version of the file:

parts.text: why does the highlighted line say it can't be found?

response.value:
The error indicating that the module cannot be found could be due to several reasons. Here are some steps to troubleshoot and resolve the issue:

1. **Check the Apex Class**:
   - Ensure that the [`QueryController`](command:_github.copilot.openSymbolFromReferences?%5B%7B%22%24mid%22%3A1%2C%22path%22%3A%22%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOrder-Management-System%2F.sfdx%2Ftypings%2Flwc%2Fapex%2FQueryController.d.ts%22%2C%22scheme%22%3A%22file%22%7D%2C%7B%22line%22%3A0%2C%22character%22%3A0%7D%5D ".sfdx/typings/lwc/apex/QueryController.d.ts") Apex class exists in your Salesforce org.
   - Verify that the [`searchAccounts`](command:_github.copilot.openSymbolFromReferences?%5B%7B%22%24mid%22%3A1%2C%22path%22%3A%22%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOrder-Management-System%2F.sfdx%2Ftypings%2Flwc%2Fapex%2FQueryController.d.ts%22%2C%22scheme%22%3A%22file%22%7D%2C%7B%22line%22%3A1%2C%22character%22%3A2%7D%5D ".sfdx/typings/lwc/apex/QueryController.d.ts") method is defined as `@AuraEnabled` in the [`QueryController`](command:_github.copilot.openSymbolFromReferences?%5B%7B%22%24mid%22%3A1%2C%22path%22%3A%22%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOrder-Management-System%2F.sfdx%2Ftypings%2Flwc%2Fapex%2FQueryController.d.ts%22%2C%22scheme%22%3A%22file%22%7D%2C%7B%22line%22%3A0%2C%22character%22%3A0%7D%5D ".sfdx/typings/lwc/apex/QueryController.d.ts") class.

2. **Check the Import Path**:
   - Ensure that the import path is correct. The path should match the exact namespace and class name in Salesforce.

3. **Check Deployment**:
   - Make sure that the [`QueryController`](command:_github.copilot.openSymbolFromReferences?%5B%7B%22%24mid%22%3A1%2C%22path%22%3A%22%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOrder-Management-System%2F.sfdx%2Ftypings%2Flwc%2Fapex%2FQueryController.d.ts%22%2C%22scheme%22%3A%22file%22%7D%2C%7B%22line%22%3A0%2C%22character%22%3A0%7D%5D ".sfdx/typings/lwc/apex/QueryController.d.ts") class has been deployed to the org where you are running the JavaScript code.

4. **Check Permissions**:
   - Ensure that the user running the JavaScript code has the necessary permissions to access the [`QueryController`](command:_github.copilot.openSymbolFromReferences?%5B%7B%22%24mid%22%3A1%2C%22path%22%3A%22%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOrder-Management-System%2F.sfdx%2Ftypings%2Flwc%2Fapex%2FQueryController.d.ts%22%2C%22scheme%22%3A%22file%22%7D%2C%7B%22line%22%3A0%2C%22character%22%3A0%7D%5D ".sfdx/typings/lwc/apex/QueryController.d.ts") class and the [`searchAccounts`](command:_github.copilot.openSymbolFromReferences?%5B%7B%22%24mid%22%3A1%2C%22path%22%3A%22%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOrder-Management-System%2F.sfdx%2Ftypings%2Flwc%2Fapex%2FQueryController.d.ts%22%2C%22scheme%22%3A%22file%22%7D%2C%7B%22line%22%3A1%2C%22character%22%3A2%7D%5D ".sfdx/typings/lwc/apex/QueryController.d.ts") method.

5. **Check for Namespace**:
   - If your Salesforce org uses a namespace, ensure that the namespace is included in the import path.

6. **Check for Compilation Issues**:
   - Sometimes, Salesforce might not compile the Apex class correctly. Try saving the [`QueryController`](command:_github.copilot.openSymbolFromReferences?%5B%7B%22%24mid%22%3A1%2C%22path%22%3A%22%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOrder-Management-System%2F.sfdx%2Ftypings%2Flwc%2Fapex%2FQueryController.d.ts%22%2C%22scheme%22%3A%22file%22%7D%2C%7B%22line%22%3A0%2C%22character%22%3A0%7D%5D ".sfdx/typings/lwc/apex/QueryController.d.ts") class again in the Developer Console or your IDE.

Here is an example of how the [`QueryController`](command:_github.copilot.openSymbolFromReferences?%5B%7B%22%24mid%22%3A1%2C%22path%22%3A%22%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOrder-Management-System%2F.sfdx%2Ftypings%2Flwc%2Fapex%2FQueryController.d.ts%22%2C%22scheme%22%3A%22file%22%7D%2C%7B%22line%22%3A0%2C%22character%22%3A0%7D%5D ".sfdx/typings/lwc/apex/QueryController.d.ts") class should look:

```apex
public with sharing class QueryController {
    @AuraEnabled
    public static List<Account> searchAccounts(String searchTerm) {
        // Your implementation here
    }
}
```

If everything seems correct and the issue persists, try the following steps:

1. **Clear Cache**:
   - Clear the cache and hard reload the page in your browser.

2. **Re-deploy the Apex Class**:
   - Re-deploy the `QueryController` class to ensure it is correctly deployed.

3. **Check for Typos**:
   - Double-check for any typos in the import statement or the Apex class name and method.

By following these steps, you should be able to identify and resolve the issue with the import statement.

response.value: Let's verify if the variables used in the `lightning-input` and `lightning-datatable` components in the HTML file match the `@track` variables in the JavaScript file. ### JavaScript: [`orderForm.js`](command:_github.copilot.openRelativePath?%5B%7B%22scheme%22%3A%22file%22%2C%22authority%22%3A%22%22%2C%22path%22%3A%22%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOrder-Management-System%2Fforce-app%2Fmain%2Fdefault%2Flwc%2ForderForm%2ForderForm.js%22%2C%22query%22%3A%22%22%2C%22fragment%22%3A%22%22%7D%5D "/Users/thbui/Documents/Salesforce/Order-Management-System/force-app/main/default/lwc/orderForm/orderForm.js") #### @track Variables ```javascript @track patientSearchTerm = ''; @track patients; @track patientError; patientColumns = [ { label: 'First Name', fieldName: 'FirstName__c', type: 'text' }, { label: 'Last Name', fieldName: 'LastName__c', type: 'text' }, { label: 'Date of Birth', fieldName: 'DOB__c', type: 'text' }, { label: 'Sex', fieldName: 'Sex__c', type: 'text' }, { label: 'Middle Initial', fieldName: 'MI__c', type: 'text' }, { label: 'Address', fieldName: 'Address__c', type: 'text' }, { label: 'City', fieldName: 'City__c', type: 'text' }, { label: 'State', fieldName: 'State__c', type: 'text' }, { label: 'Zip', fieldName: 'ZipCode__c', type: 'text' } ]; ``` ### HTML: `orderForm.html` Ensure that the `lightning-input` and `lightning-datatable` components use the correct variables. #### Example of `lightning-input` ```html ``` #### Example of `lightning-datatable` ```html ``` ### Steps to Verify 1. **Check `lightning-input`**: Ensure that the `value` attribute of `lightning-input` matches the `@track` variable `patientSearchTerm`. 2. **Check `lightning-datatable`**: Ensure that the `data` attribute of `lightning-datatable` matches the `@track` variable `patients` and the `columns` attribute matches the `patientColumns` array. ### Example HTML Code ```html ``` ### Summary - Ensure that the `value` attribute in `lightning-input` is bound to [`patientSearchTerm`](command:_github.copilot.openSymbolFromReferences?%5B%7B%22%24mid%22%3A1%2C%22fsPath%22%3A%22%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOrder-Management-System%2Fforce-app%2Fmain%2Fdefault%2Flwc%2ForderForm%2ForderForm.js%22%2C%22external%22%3A%22file%3A%2F%2F%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOrder-Management-System%2Fforce-app%2Fmain%2Fdefault%2Flwc%2ForderForm%2ForderForm.js%22%2C%22path%22%3A%22%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOrder-Management-System%2Fforce-app%2Fmain%2Fdefault%2Flwc%2ForderForm%2ForderForm.js%22%2C%22scheme%22%3A%22file%22%7D%2C%7B%22line%22%3A133%2C%22character%22%3A4%7D%5D "force-app/main/default/lwc/orderForm/orderForm.js"). - Ensure that the `data` attribute in `lightning-datatable` is bound to [`patients`](command:_github.copilot.openSymbolFromReferences?%5B%7B%22%24mid%22%3A1%2C%22fsPath%22%3A%22%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOrder-Management-System%2Fforce-app%2Fmain%2Fdefault%2Flwc%2ForderForm%2ForderForm.js%22%2C%22external%22%3A%22file%3A%2F%2F%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOrder-Management-System%2Fforce-app%2Fmain%2Fdefault%2Flwc%2ForderForm%2ForderForm.js%22%2C%22path%22%3A%22%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOrder-Management-System%2Fforce-app%2Fmain%2Fdefault%2Flwc%2ForderForm%2ForderForm.js%22%2C%22scheme%22%3A%22file%22%7D%2C%7B%22line%22%3A134%2C%22character%22%3A4%7D%5D "force-app/main/default/lwc/orderForm/orderForm.js"). - Ensure that the `columns` attribute in `lightning-datatable` is bound to [`patientColumns`](command:_github.copilot.openSymbolFromReferences?%5B%7B%22%24mid%22%3A1%2C%22fsPath%22%3A%22%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOrder-Management-System%2Fforce-app%2Fmain%2Fdefault%2Flwc%2ForderForm%2ForderForm.js%22%2C%22external%22%3A%22file%3A%2F%2F%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOrder-Management-System%2Fforce-app%2Fmain%2Fdefault%2Flwc%2ForderForm%2ForderForm.js%22%2C%22path%22%3A%22%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOrder-Management-System%2Fforce-app%2Fmain%2Fdefault%2Flwc%2ForderForm%2ForderForm.js%22%2C%22scheme%22%3A%22file%22%7D%2C%7B%22line%22%3A137%2C%22character%22%3A4%7D%5D "force-app/main/default/lwc/orderForm/orderForm.js"). response.value:
The error "LIKE operator only valid on string field" suggests that one or more fields in your SOQL query are not of type `String`. The fields you are querying against (`FirstName__c`, `LastName__c`, `Email__c`, `NPI__c`) must all be of type `String` for the `LIKE` operator to work.

To debug this issue, you should:

1. Verify the data types of the fields in your Salesforce schema.
2. Ensure that all fields used in the `LIKE` clause are of type `String`.

Here is the relevant part of your SOQL query in [`force-app/main/default/classes/QueryController.cls`](command:_github.copilot.openRelativePath?%5B%7B%22scheme%22%3A%22file%22%2C%22authority%22%3A%22%22%2C%22path%22%3A%22%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOrder-Management-System%2Fforce-app%2Fmain%2Fdefault%2Fclasses%2FQueryController.cls%22%2C%22query%22%3A%22%22%2C%22fragment%22%3A%22%22%7D%5D "/Users/thbui/Documents/Salesforce/Order-Management-System/force-app/main/default/classes/QueryController.cls"):
```cls
'FirstName__c LIKE :physicianSearchTerm OR LastName__c LIKE :physicianSearchTerm OR Email__c LIKE :physicianSearchTerm OR NPI__c LIKE :physicianSearchTerm';
```

### Steps to Fix:

1. **Check Field Types in Salesforce Schema:**
   - Ensure that `FirstName__c`, `LastName__c`, `Email__c`, and `NPI__c` are all `String` fields.

2. **Modify the Query if Necessary:**
   - If any of these fields are not `String`, you will need to either change the field type in Salesforce or adjust your query to only include `String` fields.

### Example of Correct Query:
Assuming all fields are of type `String`, your query should work as expected. If any field is not a `String`, you need to remove it from the `LIKE` clause or convert it to a `String` type.

### Example of Adjusted Query:
If `NPI__c` is not a `String`, you might adjust your query like this:
```cls
'FirstName__c LIKE :physicianSearchTerm OR LastName__c LIKE :physicianSearchTerm OR Email__c LIKE :physicianSearchTerm';
```

### Verify and Update Field Types:
1. Go to Salesforce Setup.
2. Navigate to the Object Manager.
3. Select the object that contains `FirstName__c`, `LastName__c`, `Email__c`, and `NPI__c`.
4. Check the field types and ensure they are `String`.

### Update the Apex Class:
If you need to adjust the query, update the [`QueryController.cls`](command:_github.copilot.openRelativePath?%5B%7B%22scheme%22%3A%22file%22%2C%22authority%22%3A%22%22%2C%22path%22%3A%22%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOrder-Management-System%2Fforce-app%2Fmain%2Fdefault%2Fclasses%2FQueryController.cls%22%2C%22query%22%3A%22%22%2C%22fragment%22%3A%22%22%7D%5D "/Users/thbui/Documents/Salesforce/Order-Management-System/force-app/main/default/classes/QueryController.cls") file accordingly.

If all fields are confirmed to be `String` and the issue persists, please provide more details about the field types or any additional error messages you encounter.

followups.message: How can I handle searching for facilities by name and address in Salesforce using Apex?

response.value:
To include `facilityColumns` and `facilityFieldMapping` based on the provided `Ordering_Account__c` extraction, you can define these mappings and columns as follows:

### Updated [`OrderTestHandler.cls`](command:_github.copilot.openRelativePath?%5B%7B%22scheme%22%3A%22file%22%2C%22authority%22%3A%22%22%2C%22path%22%3A%22%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOrder-Management-System%2Fforce-app%2Fmain%2Fdefault%2Fclasses%2FOrderTestHandler.cls%22%2C%22query%22%3A%22%22%2C%22fragment%22%3A%22%22%7D%5D "/Users/thbui/Documents/Salesforce/Order-Management-System/force-app/main/default/classes/OrderTestHandler.cls")

```apex
// Define facility columns
List<String> facilityColumns = new List<String>{
    'FacilityName__c',
    'Address__c',
    'ZipCode__c',
    'City__c',
    'State__c',
    'Country__c',
    'Phone__c',
    'Email__c'
};

// Define facility field mapping
Map<String, String> facilityFieldMapping = new Map<String, String>{
    'orderingFacilityName' => 'FacilityName__c',
    'orderingAddress.street' => 'Address__c',
    'orderingAddress.postalCode' => 'ZipCode__c',
    'orderingAddress.city' => 'City__c',
    'orderingAddress.province' => 'State__c',
    'orderingAddress.country' => 'Country__c',
    'orderingPhone' => 'Phone__c',
    'orderingEmail' => 'Email__c'
};

// Extract ordering facility information
Ordering_Account__c orderingFacilityInfo = new Ordering_Account__c(
    FacilityName__c = (String) input.get('orderingFacilityName'),
    Address__c = (String) ((Map<String, Object>) input.get('orderingAddress')).get('street'),
    ZipCode__c = (String) ((Map<String, Object>) input.get('orderingAddress')).get('postalCode'),
    City__c = (String) ((Map<String, Object>) input.get('orderingAddress')).get('city'),
    State__c = (String) ((Map<String, Object>) input.get('orderingAddress')).get('province'),
    Country__c = (String) ((Map<String, Object>) input.get('orderingAddress')).get('country'),
    Phone__c = (String) input.get('orderingPhone'),
    Email__c = (String) input.get('orderingEmail')
);
System.debug('orderingFacilityInfo: ' + orderingFacilityInfo);
```

### Summary

- `facilityColumns` is a list of the fields in `Ordering_Account__c`.
- `facilityFieldMapping` is a map that associates input keys to the corresponding fields in `Ordering_Account__c`.

This setup ensures that you have a clear mapping and list of columns for the `Ordering_Account__c` object.

```javascript
facilityColumns = [

];

facilityFieldMapping = {

    'orderingAddress.postalCode': 'ZipCode__c',
    'orderingAddress.city': 'City__c',
    'orderingAddress.province': 'State__c',
    'orderingAddress.country': 'Country__c',
    orderingPhone: 'Phone__c',
    orderingEmail: 'Email__c'
};
```

response.value:
The provided excerpt from the [`Patient__c.object-meta.xml`](command:_github.copilot.openRelativePath?%5B%7B%22scheme%22%3A%22file%22%2C%22authority%22%3A%22%22%2C%22path%22%3A%22%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOrder-Management-System%2Fforce-app%2Fmain%2Fdefault%2Fobjects%2FPatient__c%2FPatient__c.object-meta.xml%22%2C%22query%22%3A%22%22%2C%22fragment%22%3A%22%22%7D%5D "/Users/thbui/Documents/Salesforce/Order-Management-System/force-app/main/default/objects/Patient__c/Patient__c.object-meta.xml") file defines the metadata for the `Patient__c` custom object in Salesforce. However, it does not include field-level security or permissions for specific profiles, such as the System Administrator.

To ensure that the System Administrator can see all fields in the `Patient__c` object, you need to configure the field-level security in the profile settings or permission sets. This is typically done through the Salesforce UI or by defining the permissions in a profile or permission set metadata file.

### Example: Profile Metadata for System Administrator

Here is an example of how you might define the field-level security for the System Administrator profile in a profile metadata file:

```xml
<Profile xmlns="http://soap.sforce.com/2006/04/metadata">
    <fieldPermissions>
        <editable>true</editable>
        <field>Patient__c.FieldName__c</field>
        <readable>true</readable>
    </fieldPermissions>
    <!-- Repeat <fieldPermissions> for each field in the Patient__c object -->
    <objectPermissions>
        <allowCreate>true</allowCreate>
        <allowDelete>true</allowDelete>
        <allowEdit>true</allowEdit>
        <allowRead>true</allowRead>
        <modifyAllRecords>true</modifyAllRecords>
        <object>Patient__c</object>
        <viewAllRecords>true</viewAllRecords>
    </objectPermissions>
</Profile>
```

### Example: Permission Set Metadata

Alternatively, you can use a permission set to grant access to all fields in the `Patient__c` object:

```xml
<PermissionSet xmlns="http://soap.sforce.com/2006/04/metadata">
    <fieldPermissions>
        <editable>true</editable>
        <field>Patient__c.FieldName__c</field>
        <readable>true</readable>
    </fieldPermissions>
    <!-- Repeat <fieldPermissions> for each field in the Patient__c object -->
    <objectPermissions>
        <allowCreate>true</allowCreate>
        <allowDelete>true</allowDelete>
        <allowEdit>true</allowEdit>
        <allowRead>true</allowRead>
        <modifyAllRecords>true</modifyAllRecords>
        <object>Patient__c</object>
        <viewAllRecords>true</viewAllRecords>
    </objectPermissions>
</PermissionSet>
```

### Steps to Configure in Salesforce UI

1. **Go to Setup**: Log in to Salesforce and go to Setup.
2. **Profiles**: Navigate to Profiles and select the System Administrator profile.
3. **Object Settings**: In the profile settings, go to Object Settings and select the `Patient__c` object.
4. **Field Permissions**: Ensure that all fields are set to visible and editable as needed.

By configuring the field-level security and object permissions, you can ensure that the System Administrator has access to all fields in the `Patient__c` object.

response.value:
To add field permissions for all custom fields in the `Patient__c` object, you need to include `<fieldPermissions>` elements for each field. Here is an example of how to add these permissions:

```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<PermissionSet xmlns="http://soap.sforce.com/2006/04/metadata">
    <objectPermissions>
        <object>Patient__c</object>
        <allowCreate>true</allowCreate>
        <allowDelete>true</allowDelete>
        <allowEdit>true</allowEdit>
        <allowRead>true</allowRead>
        <modifyAllRecords>true</modifyAllRecords>
        <viewAllRecords>true</viewAllRecords>
    </objectPermissions>
    <fieldPermissions>
        <editable>true</editable>
        <field>Patient__c.CustomField1__c</field>
        <readable>true</readable>
    </fieldPermissions>
    <fieldPermissions>
        <editable>true</editable>
        <field>Patient__c.CustomField2__c</field>
        <readable>true</readable>
    </fieldPermissions>
    <fieldPermissions>
        <editable>true</editable>
        <field>Patient__c.CustomField3__c</field>
        <readable>true</readable>
    </fieldPermissions>
    <!-- Add more fieldPermissions as needed for each custom field in Patient__c -->
    <objectPermissions>
        <object>TestOrder__c</object>
        <allowCreate>true</allowCreate>
        <allowDelete>true</allowDelete>
        <allowEdit>true</allowEdit>
        <allowRead>true</allowRead>
        <modifyAllRecords>true</modifyAllRecords>
        <viewAllRecords>true</viewAllRecords>
    </objectPermissions>
    <objectPermissions>
        <object>Treating_Physician_Information__c</object>
        <allowCreate>true</allowCreate>
        <allowDelete>true</allowDelete>
        <allowEdit>true</allowEdit>
        <allowRead>true</allowRead>
        <modifyAllRecords>true</modifyAllRecords>
        <viewAllRecords>true</viewAllRecords>
    </objectPermissions>
    <objectPermissions>
        <object>Ordering_Account__c</object>
        <allowCreate>true</allowCreate>
        <allowDelete>true</allowDelete>
        <allowEdit>true</allowEdit>
        <allowRead>true</allowRead>
        <modifyAllRecords>true</modifyAllRecords>
        <viewAllRecords>true</viewAllRecords>
    </objectPermissions>
</PermissionSet>
```

Replace `CustomField1__c`, `CustomField2__c`, `CustomField3__c`, etc., with the actual API names of the custom fields in the `Patient__c` object. Repeat the `<fieldPermissions>` block for each custom field you need to include.

response.value:
In Salesforce, field names are case-insensitive. However, it's a good practice to use the exact case as defined in the Salesforce schema for consistency and readability. If the fields are defined with specific capitalization in your Salesforce schema, you should use that exact capitalization in your metadata files.

Here is the updated `Admin.profile-meta.xml` file with the field names capitalized as specified:

```xml

        <allowCreate>true</allowCreate>
        <allowDelete>true</allowDelete>
        <allowEdit>true</allowEdit>
        <allowRead>true</allowRead>
        <modifyAllRecords>true</modifyAllRecords>
        <viewAllRecords>true</viewAllRecords>
```

To debug the [`Admin.profile-meta.xml`](command:_github.copilot.openRelativePath?%5B%7B%22scheme%22%3A%22file%22%2C%22authority%22%3A%22%22%2C%22path%22%3A%22%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOrder-Management-System%2Fforce-app%2Fmain%2Fdefault%2Fprofiles%2FAdmin.profile-meta.xml%22%2C%22query%22%3A%22%22%2C%22fragment%22%3A%22%22%7D%5D "/Users/thbui/Documents/Salesforce/Order-Management-System/force-app/main/default/profiles/Admin.profile-meta.xml") file located at [`force-app/main/default/profiles/Admin.profile-meta.xml`](command:_github.copilot.openRelativePath?%5B%7B%22scheme%22%3A%22file%22%2C%22authority%22%3A%22%22%2C%22path%22%3A%22%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOrder-Management-System%2Fforce-app%2Fmain%2Fdefault%2Fprofiles%2FAdmin.profile-meta.xml%22%2C%22query%22%3A%22%22%2C%22fragment%22%3A%22%22%7D%5D "/Users/thbui/Documents/Salesforce/Order-Management-System/force-app/main/default/profiles/Admin.profile-meta.xml"), you should ensure that the XML structure is correct and that all necessary permissions are properly defined. Here are a few steps to help you debug:

1. **Check XML Syntax**:
   Ensure that the XML tags are properly opened and closed. Each `<fieldPermissions>` and `<objectPermissions>` tag should be correctly nested.

2. **Verify Field Permissions**:
   Make sure that each `<fieldPermissions>` block includes both `<editable>` and `<readable>` tags, and that they are correctly set to `true` or `false`.

3. **Verify Object Permissions**:
   Each `<objectPermissions>` block should include the necessary permissions such as `<allowCreate>`, `<allowDelete>`, `<allowEdit>`, `<allowRead>`, `<modifyAllRecords>`, and `<viewAllRecords>`.

4. **Ensure Consistency**:
   Verify that the fields and objects referenced in the permissions exist in your Salesforce schema.

Here is a snippet of the [`Admin.profile-meta.xml`](command:_github.copilot.openRelativePath?%5B%7B%22scheme%22%3A%22file%22%2C%22authority%22%3A%22%22%2C%22path%22%3A%22%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOrder-Management-System%2Fforce-app%2Fmain%2Fdefault%2Fprofiles%2FAdmin.profile-meta.xml%22%2C%22query%22%3A%22%22%2C%22fragment%22%3A%22%22%7D%5D "/Users/thbui/Documents/Salesforce/Order-Management-System/force-app/main/default/profiles/Admin.profile-meta.xml") file with proper structure for reference:

```xml

        <modifyAllRecords>true</modifyAllRecords>
        <viewAllRecords>true</viewAllRecords>
    </objectPermissions>
    <!-- Patient field permissions -->
    <fieldPermissions>
        <editable>true</editable>
        <field>Patient__c.firstName__c</field>
        <readable>true</readable>
    </fieldPermissions>
    <fieldPermissions>
        <editable>true</editable>
        <field>Patient__c.mi__c</field>
        <readable>true</readable>
    </fieldPermissions>
    <!-- Add more field permissions as needed -->
    
    <!-- Ordering Account Permissions -->
    <objectPermissions>
        <object>Ordering_Account__c</object>
        <allowCreate>true</allowCreate>
        <allowDelete>true</allowDelete>
        <allowEdit>true</allowEdit>
        <allowRead>true</allowRead>
        <modifyAllRecords>true</modifyAllRecords>
        <viewAllRecords>true</viewAllRecords>
    </objectPermissions>
    <!-- Ordering Account field permissions -->
    <fieldPermissions>
        <editable>true</editable>
        <field>Ordering_Account__c.FacilityName__c</field>
        <readable>true</readable>
    </fieldPermissions>
    <fieldPermissions>
        <editable>true</editable>
        <field>Ordering_Account__c.Address__c</field>
        <readable>true</readable>
    </fieldPermissions>
    <!-- Add more field permissions as needed -->
    
    <!-- Treating Physician Permissions -->
    <objectPermissions>
        <object>Treating_Physician__c</object>
        <allowCreate>true</allowCreate>
        <allowDelete>true</allowDelete>
        <allowEdit>true</allowEdit>
        <allowRead>true</allowRead>
        <modifyAllRecords>true</modifyAllRecords>
        <viewAllRecords>true</viewAllRecords>
    </objectPermissions>
    <!-- Treating Physician field permissions -->
    <fieldPermissions>
        <editable>true</editable>
        <field>Treating_Physician__c.FirstName__c</field>
        <readable>true</readable>
    </fieldPermissions>
    <fieldPermissions>

</PermissionSet>
```

response.value:
To define a field in the `Treating_Physician_Information__c` object that references the `Ordering_Account__c` object, you can create a new field metadata XML file. Here is an example of how you can define this field:

Create a new file named [`force-app/main/default/objects/Treating_Physician_Information__c/fields/Ordering_Account__c.field-meta.xml`](command:_github.copilot.openRelativePath?%5B%7B%22scheme%22%3A%22file%22%2C%22authority%22%3A%22%22%2C%22path%22%3A%22%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOrder-Management-System%2Fforce-app%2Fmain%2Fdefault%2Fobjects%2FTestOrder__c%2Ffields%2FOrdering_Account__c.field-meta.xml%22%2C%22query%22%3A%22%22%2C%22fragment%22%3A%22%22%7D%5D "/Users/thbui/Documents/Salesforce/Order-Management-System/force-app/main/default/objects/TestOrder__c/fields/Ordering_Account__c.field-meta.xml") with the following content:

```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<CustomField xmlns="http://soap.sforce.com/2006/04/metadata">
    <fullName>Ordering_Account__c</fullName>
    <deleteConstraint>SetNull</deleteConstraint>
    <label>Ordering Account</label>
    <referenceTo>Ordering_Account__c</referenceTo>
    <relationshipLabel>Ordering Account</relationshipLabel>
    <relationshipName>Ordering_Account</relationshipName>
    <required>false</required>
    <trackTrending>false</trackTrending>
    <type>Lookup</type>
</CustomField>
```

This XML defines a lookup field named `Ordering_Account__c` in the `Treating_Physician_Information__c` object that references the `Ordering_Account__c` object.

parts.text: now for the ordering account object, create a meta xml that defines a field in this object that is a list of treating_physician_information__c object

response.value:
To define a field in the `Ordering_Account__c` object that is a list of `Treating_Physician_Information__c` objects, you need to create a new field metadata XML file for a master-detail or lookup relationship. Here is an example of how you can define this field:

Create a new file named `force-app/main/default/objects/Ordering_Account__c/fields/Treating_Physician_Information__c.field-meta.xml` with the following content:

```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<CustomField xmlns="http://soap.sforce.com/2006/04/metadata">
    <fullName>Treating_Physician_Information__c</fullName>
    <externalId>false</externalId>
    <label>Treating Physician Information</label>
    <referenceTo>Treating_Physician_Information__c</referenceTo>
    <relationshipLabel>Treating Physician Information</relationshipLabel>
    <relationshipName>Treating_Physician_Informations</relationshipName>
    <required>false</required>
    <type>MasterDetail</type>
    <reparentableMasterDetail>true</reparentableMasterDetail>
    <writeRequiresMasterRead>false</writeRequiresMasterRead>
</CustomField>
```

This XML defines a master-detail relationship field named `Treating_Physician_Information__c` in the `Ordering_Account__c` object that references the `Treating_Physician_Information__c` object. The `relationshipName` is pluralized to indicate that it is a list of related records.

look at the treating physician field inside the orderring account object, and the ordering account field in the treating physician. facing this error

──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
/Users/thbui/Documents/Salesforce/Order-Management-System/force-app/main/default/objects/Ordering_Account__c/fields/Treating_Physician_Information__c.field-meta.xml  Cannot add master-detail relationship due to existing data rows (166:13)                  
/Users/thbui/Documents/Salesforce/Order-Management-System/force-app/main/default/objects/Treating_Physician_Information__c/fields/Ordering_Account__c.field-meta.xml  There is already a Child Relationship named Ordering_Account on Ordering Account. (167:13)

look at the treating physician field inside the orderring account object, and the ordering account field in the treating physician. facing this error

──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
/Users/thbui/Documents/Salesforce/Order-Management-System/force-app/main/default/objects/Ordering_Account__c/fields/Treating_Physician_Information__c.field-meta.xml  Cannot add master-detail relationship due to existing data rows (166:13)                  
/Users/thbui/Documents/Salesforce/Order-Management-System/force-app/main/default/objects/Treating_Physician_Information__c/fields/Ordering_Account__c.field-meta.xml  There is already a Child Relationship named Ordering_Account on Ordering Account. (167:13)

response.value:
The errors you're encountering are due to two main issues:

1. **Existing Data Rows**: You cannot add a master-detail relationship to an object that already contains data. You need to either delete the existing data or convert the relationship to a lookup relationship.

2. **Duplicate Child Relationship Name**: The child relationship name `Ordering_Account` is already in use. You need to use a unique relationship name.

Here are the steps to resolve these issues:

### Step 1: Change the Master-Detail Relationship to a Lookup Relationship

Update the `Treating_Physician_Information__c.field-meta.xml` file to use a lookup relationship instead of a master-detail relationship.

```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<CustomField xmlns="http://soap.sforce.com/2006/04/metadata">
    <fullName>Treating_Physician_Information__c</fullName>
    <externalId>false</externalId>
    <label>Treating Physician Information</label>
    <referenceTo>Treating_Physician_Information__c</referenceTo>
    <relationshipLabel>Treating Physician Information</relationshipLabel>
    <relationshipName>Treating_Physician_Informations</relationshipName>
    <required>false</required>
    <type>Lookup</type>
</CustomField>
```

### Step 2: Ensure Unique Relationship Names

Update the `Ordering_Account__c.field-meta.xml` file to use a unique relationship name.

```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<CustomField xmlns="http://soap.sforce.com/2006/04/metadata">
    <fullName>Ordering_Account__c</fullName>
    <deleteConstraint>SetNull</deleteConstraint>
    <label>Ordering Account</label>
    <referenceTo>Ordering_Account__c</referenceTo>
    <relationshipLabel>Ordering Account</relationshipLabel>
    <relationshipName>Ordering_Account_Relationship</relationshipName>
    <required>false</required>
    <trackTrending>false</trackTrending>
    <type>Lookup</type>
</CustomField>
```

### Step 3: Deploy the Changes

After making these changes, deploy the updated metadata to your Salesforce org.

### Step 4: Handle Existing Data (if necessary)

If you still need a master-detail relationship, you must first delete the existing data in the `Ordering_Account__c` object or migrate it to another object. Once the data is removed, you can change the relationship type back to master-detail.

### Summary

By changing the relationship type to lookup and ensuring unique relationship names, you should be able to resolve the errors and successfully deploy your metadata changes.

response.value:
The error "Could not find HEAD" typically indicates an issue with the Git repository, such as a missing or corrupted [`.git`](command:_github.copilot.openRelativePath?%5B%7B%22scheme%22%3A%22file%22%2C%22authority%22%3A%22%22%2C%22path%22%3A%22%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOrder-Management-System%2F.git%22%2C%22query%22%3A%22%22%2C%22fragment%22%3A%22%22%7D%5D "/Users/thbui/Documents/Salesforce/Order-Management-System/.git") directory. Here are the steps to resolve this issue:

1. **Check Git Repository**:
   Ensure that your project is a valid Git repository. Open the terminal in Visual Studio Code and run:
   ```sh
   git status
   ```
   If you see an error, it means your project is not a valid Git repository.

2. **Initialize Git Repository**:
   If your project is not a Git repository, you can initialize it by running:
   ```sh
   git init
   ```

3. **Check for `.git` Directory**:
   Ensure that the `.git` directory exists in your project root. If it is missing, you might need to reinitialize the repository or clone it again.

4. **Check for Corrupted `.git` Directory**:
   If the `.git` directory is corrupted, you might need to delete it and reinitialize the repository:
   ```sh
   rm -rf .git
   git init
   ```

5. **Commit Changes**:
   Ensure you have committed your changes before deploying:
   ```sh
   git add .
   git commit -m "Initial commit"
   ```

6. **Retry Deployment**:
   After ensuring your Git repository is correctly set up, retry the deployment:
   ```sh
   sfdx force:source:deploy -p path/to/your/source
   ```

If the issue persists, you might want to check your Salesforce CLI installation and ensure it is up to date:
```sh
sfdx update
```

These steps should help resolve the "Could not find HEAD" error and allow you to deploy your source to the org.

          <span class="eyebrow u-sp__mb--0-5 js-jump-link">Overview<a id="navAnchorId_0" href="#navAnchorId_0"></a></span>
    
          <h2>Ordering Overview</h2>
    
                      
  <div class="o-wysiwyg field field--name-field-text field--type-text-long"><p>Foundation Medicine tests must be ordered by a licensed physician. We offer multiple ways to order our tests:</p><ul><li><strong>Electronic Medical Record (EMR) Systems: </strong>our integrations with EMR systems, like <a href="/press-releases/a319c9ce-9025-4170-a376-de22b5c99481" title="">Epic®</a> and <a href="/press-releases/ba49795c-659b-4b11-9e4c-57faed61fda4" title="">OncoEMR®</a>, will allow you to place an order for a test directly through your practice's EMR system if enabled</li><li><strong>Foundation Medicine’s Online Portal: </strong><a href="https://home.foundationmedicine.com/login" title="">login</a> or <a href="https://home.foundationmedicine.com/signup" title="">sign up</a> for an online account</li><li><strong>Email or Fax:</strong> download or print our <a href="/media/409/fmi-view" data-entity-type="media" data-entity-uuid="d8d14e19-d04e-4b37-9f49-58b4c4387f2e" data-entity-substitution="fmi_media_fmi_canonical" title="Test Requisition Form (TRF)">Test Requisition Form</a>. Completed forms and associated attachments can be submitted via email to <a href="mailto:client.services@foundationmedicine.com" title="">client.services@foundationmedicine.com</a> or via fax to +1 (617) 418-2290</li></ul><p>If sending a solid tumor specimen, Foundation Medicine can complete the specimen retrieval process if requested on the order form (complete pathology lab information must be provided). If sending peripheral blood or bone marrow aspirate, please order the appropriate test kit with the form below to your practice and follow the specimen preparation instructions for liquid specimens.</p><p><strong>International Customers</strong>: To order, please visit <a href="https://www.rochefoundationmedicine.com/" title="">rochefoundationmedicine.com</a> or call +1 (888) 988-3639.</p></div>

              </div>

  <section data-component-id="foundationmedicine:section" class="c-section vsp__none bsp__large">
  <div class="l-container">

          <div class="c-section__top ">
        <div class="c-section__top__inner">
                      <span class="js-jump-link">How to Order<a id="navAnchorId_1" href="#navAnchorId_1"></a></span>
          
                      <h2 class="">How to Order a Foundation Medicine Test</h2>
          
                        </div>
      </div>
    
    <div class="c-section__content">
            <div class="l-grid l-grid--100">

          <div class="layout__region layout__region--first l-paragraphs">
        




      
          
    
  
      
          
    
  
      
          
    
  



    
  
    
  
    
  
<div data-component-id="foundationmedicine:horizontal-tabs" class="c-tabs-horizontal js-tabs" data-once="foundationmedicineTabs">
  <div class="c-tabs-horizontal__sidebar">
    <div role="tablist" aria-orientation="horizontal" class="c-tabs-horizontal__tabs u-display--desktop" aria-labelledby="tablist--2">
              <button id="tab--4" class="o-btn o-btn--tertiary" type="button" role="tab" aria-selected="true" aria-controls="tabpanel--4">
            Solid Specimen Ordering Process
        </button>
              <button id="tab--5" class="o-btn o-btn--tertiary" type="button" role="tab" aria-selected="false" aria-controls="tabpanel--5" tabindex="-1">
            Liquid Specimen Ordering Process
        </button>
              <button id="tab--6" class="o-btn o-btn--tertiary" type="button" role="tab" aria-selected="false" aria-controls="tabpanel--6" tabindex="-1">
            Monitoring Ordering Process
        </button>
          </div>

        <div class="c-dropdown u-display--mobile" data-once="fmiDropdown">
	<select class="c-dropdown__native js-dropdown-native" aria-labelledby="tablist--2">
		
									<option value="tabpanel--4">Solid Specimen Ordering Process</option>
							<option value="tabpanel--5">Liquid Specimen Ordering Process</option>
							<option value="tabpanel--6">Monitoring Ordering Process</option>
						</select>

	
</div>


  </div>

  <div class="c-tabs-horizontal__content">
          
                              
      
      <div id="tabpanel--4" role="tabpanel" aria-labelledby="tab--4" tabindex="0" class="c-tabs-horizontal__item--rich-text t-white">
          <div class="paragraph paragraph--type--tabs-item-horizontal paragraph--view-mode--default">
            


<div class="o-wysiwyg">
    <p>If you will be sending an FFPE block or unstained slides to Foundation Medicine for testing with FoundationOne<sup>®</sup>CDx or FoundationOne<sup>®</sup>Heme, please follow the instructions below:</p><ol><li>Place a test order through your EMR system if enabled or order online by <a href="https://home.foundationmedicine.com/login" title="">logging in</a> or <a href="https://home.foundationmedicine.com/signup" title="">signing-up</a> for a Foundation Medicine account. Orders can also be submitted via <a href="mailto:client.services@foundationmedicine.com" title="">email</a> or fax using our<a href="/media/409/fmi-view" data-entity-type="media" data-entity-uuid="d8d14e19-d04e-4b37-9f49-58b4c4387f2e" data-entity-substitution="fmi_media_fmi_canonical" title="Test Requisition Form (TRF)"> Test Requisition Form</a>.</li><li>Complete the order form, provide any required attachments including Advanced Beneficiary Notice if needed, and submit. Some pathology labs require patient consent prior to releasing a specimen for testing, so providing us with a completed <a href="/media/362/fmi-view" data-entity-type="media" data-entity-uuid="5fb7f2e3-8fd7-4b27-97f0-e61d8b7f11e8" data-entity-substitution="fmi_media_fmi_canonical" title="Specimen Release Consent Form">Specimen Release Consent Form</a> up front can help avoid potential order delays.</li><li>Foundation Medicine will contact the pathologist if requested during the ordering process with instructions for sample procurement and shipment. If you will be arranging for specimen shipment yourself, please do so after submitting the order form. To request a Specimen Shipping Kit please contact <a href="mailto:client.services@foundationmedicine.com" title="">client services</a> or fill out our Order a Shipping Kit form below.</li><li>You will receive online or printed results typically 8 days or less from receipt of specimen for FoundationOne CDx.</li></ol><p> </p>

</div>


      </div>

      </div>
          
                              
      
      <div id="tabpanel--5" role="tabpanel" aria-labelledby="tab--5" tabindex="0" class="is-hidden c-tabs-horizontal__item--rich-text t-white">
          <div class="paragraph paragraph--type--tabs-item-horizontal paragraph--view-mode--default">
            


<div class="o-wysiwyg">
    <p>If you will be sending peripheral whole blood or bone marrow aspirate to Foundation Medicine for testing with FoundationOne<sup>®</sup>Liquid CDx or FoundationOne<sup>®</sup>Heme, please follow the instructions below:</p><ol><li>Place a test order through your EMR if enabled or order online by <a href="https://home.foundationmedicine.com/login" title="">logging in</a> or <a href="https://home.foundationmedicine.com/signup" title="">signing-up</a> for a Foundation Medicine account. Orders can also be submitted via <a href="mailto:client.services@foundationmedicine.com" title="">email</a> or fax using our<a href="/media/409/fmi-view" data-entity-type="media" data-entity-uuid="d8d14e19-d04e-4b37-9f49-58b4c4387f2e" data-entity-substitution="fmi_media_fmi_canonical" title="Test Requisition Form (TRF)"> Test Requisition Form</a>.</li><li>Complete the order form, provide any required attachments including Advanced Beneficiary Notice if needed, and submit.</li><li>If collecting the sample in-office, request a Specimen Shipping Kit to your practice using the form below or by contacting our client services team. Mobile phlebotomy is also available for patients if preferred.</li><li>Once the kit arrives, collect the blood or bone marrow sample from your patient per the specimen instructions for the appropriate test and label tubes with two patient-specific identifiers.</li><li>Send the sample overnight to Foundation Medicine using the FedEx pack included in the kit.</li><li>You will receive online or printed results typically 7 days or less from receipt of specimen for FoundationOne Liquid CDx.</li></ol><p> </p>

</div>


      </div>

      </div>
          
                              
      
      <div id="tabpanel--6" role="tabpanel" aria-labelledby="tab--6" tabindex="0" class="is-hidden c-tabs-horizontal__item--rich-text t-white">
          <div class="paragraph paragraph--type--tabs-item-horizontal paragraph--view-mode--default">
            


<div class="o-wysiwyg">
    <p class="p1">FoundationOne<sup>®</sup>Tracker can be added to any prior FoundationOne<sup>®</sup>CDx test with results reported August 20, 2019, or later. Alternatively, FoundationOne Tracker can be ordered together with a new FoundationOne CDx test. Please follow the instructions below to place an order in the Foundation Medicine portal:</p><ol><li><p class="p1">Place a test order through your EMR system if enabled or order online by logging in or signing-up for a Foundation Medicine account.</p></li><li><p class="p1">If you need to create an account, visit foundationmedicine.com and click on the "Create an Account" link in the upper right corner of the screen.</p></li><li><p class="p1">Once your account is confirmed, click "Order a Test" from the homepage. You will be prompted to select which test type you would like to order - either a Monitoring Test or a Genomic Profiling Test. Click "Monitoring".</p></li><li><p class="p1">In the "Patient Information" section you will be able to enter your patient's details. If the patient has already had a Foundation Medicine test, you can select their name from the dropdown menu that appears. By selecting the patient from the list, their test history and information will automatically populate. This step is necessary to link an existing FoundationOne CDx baseline test to a FoundationOne Tracker Monitoring Series.</p><p class="p1">- If the patient does not have a previous FoundationOne CDx test eligible to add FoundationOne Tracker, please select the FoundationOne CDx + FoundationOne Tracker option to place these orders together.</p></li><li><p class="p1">Complete the order form, provide any required attachments including Advanced Beneficiary Notice if needed, and submit.</p></li></ol>

</div>


      </div>

      </div>
      </div>

</div>

      </div>
    
  </div>

      </div>

  </div>
</section>

  <div class="o-wysiwyg--12 o-wysiwyg field field--name-field-text field--type-text-long"><p>Foundation Medicine offers in-home blood draw services through a mobile phlebotomy vendor to support broader access to FoundationOne Liquid CDx and FoundationOne Heme, at no additional cost.           <h2>Portfolio Reflex Option</h2>
    
                      
  <div class="o-wysiwyg--12 o-wysiwyg field field--name-field-text field--type-text-long"><p>We offer the option to automatically reflex between tissue and liquid sample types using our FDA-approved Portfolio of FoundationOne CDx and FoundationOne Liquid CDx. If the "Portfolio Reflex" option is selected during the online ordering process or on our Test Requisition Form, we will proceed with the initial CGP test selected and if the specimen does not meet the criteria for successful testing, we will automatically reflex to the other test and procure a new specimen. The failed test is not billed, and the successful test will be billed according to our standard practices.</p></div>

      <span class="o-accordion-item__title">

        <svg class="o-accordion-item__icon o-accordion-item__icon--plus"><use href="#plus"></use></svg>

          <p>Foundation Medicine test reports can be accessed as soon as results are ready via our digital reporting portal or our mobile app – <a href="https://home.foundationmedicine.com/login">log in</a> or <a href="https://home.foundationmedicine.com/signup">sign up</a> for a Foundation Medicine account or <a href="https://apps.apple.com/us/app/foundation-medicine/id1319002478">download our iOS app</a> to obtain access. You can also receive access to results via secure email or request to have results faxed to you by reaching out to our Client Services team at <a href="mailto:client.services@foundationmedicine.com">client.services@foundationmedicine.com</a> or by phone at +1 (888) 988-3639.</p>

                      <h2 class="">Important Safety Information</h2>

    <div class="c-section__content">
            <div class="l-grid l-grid--100">

          <div class="layout__region layout__region--first l-paragraphs">
          <div class="paragraph paragraph--type--block paragraph--view-mode--default">
          
            <div class="field field--name-field-block-plugin field--type-entity-reference field--label-hidden field__item">



  
                    
        
      
                    
        
      
                    
        
      

<div id="block-foundationmedicine-isiblock" class="block block-fmi-paragraphs block-isi-block">
  
  

          


    
  
    
  
    
  
<div data-component-id="foundationmedicine:vertical-tabs" class="c-tabs-vertical js-tabs" data-once="foundationmedicineTabs">
  <div class="c-tabs-vertical__sidebar">

    <h3 id="tablist" class="h5 u-display--desktop">
      Select
    </h3>
    <div role="tablist" aria-orientation="vertical" class="c-tabs-vertical__tabs u-display--desktop" aria-labelledby="tablist">
              <button id="iss-tab--1" class="text-v-tabs-buttons" type="button" role="tab" aria-selected="true" aria-controls="iss-tabpanel--1">
            FoundationOne®CDx
        </button>
              <button id="iss-tab--2" class="text-v-tabs-buttons" type="button" role="tab" aria-selected="false" aria-controls="iss-tabpanel--2" tabindex="-1">
            FoundationOne®Tracker
        </button>
              <button id="iss-tab--3" class="text-v-tabs-buttons" type="button" role="tab" aria-selected="false" aria-controls="iss-tabpanel--3" tabindex="-1">

        <div class="c-dropdown u-display--mobile" data-once="fmiDropdown">
	<select class="c-dropdown__native js-dropdown-native" aria-labelledby="tablist">
		
									<option value="iss-tabpanel--1">FoundationOne®CDx</option>
							<option value="iss-tabpanel--2">FoundationOne®Tracker</option>
							<option value="iss-tabpanel--3">FoundationOne®Liquid CDx</option>
						</select>

	
</div>

  <div class="c-tabs-vertical__content">
          
                              
      
      <div id="iss-tabpanel--1" role="tabpanel" aria-labelledby="iss-tab--1" tabindex="0" class="c-tabs-vertical__item--rich-text t-white">
          
  <div class="o-wysiwyg--14 o-wysiwyg field field--name-field-isi field--type-text-long"><h3 class="h5">FoundationOne CDx</h3><p>FoundationOne®CDx is a qualitative next-generation sequencing based in vitro diagnostic test for cancer patients with solid tumors and is for prescription use only. The test analyzes 324 genes as well as genomic signatures including microsatellite instability (MSI) and tumor mutational burden (TMB) and is a companion diagnostic to identify patients who may benefit from treatment with specific therapies in accordance with the approved therapeutic product labeling. Additional genomic findings may be reported and are not prescriptive or conclusive for labeled use of any specific therapeutic product. Use of the test does not guarantee a patient will be matched to a treatment. A negative result does not rule out the presence of an alteration. Some patients may require a biopsy. For the complete label, including companion diagnostic indications and important risk information, please visit <a href="http://www.F1CDxLabel.com">www.F1CDxLabel.com</a></p></div>

      </div>
          
                              
      
      <div id="iss-tabpanel--2" role="tabpanel" aria-labelledby="iss-tab--2" tabindex="0" class="is-hidden c-tabs-vertical__item--rich-text t-white">
          
  <div class="o-wysiwyg--14 o-wysiwyg field field--name-field-isi field--type-text-long"><h3 class="h5">FoundationOne Tracker</h3><p><u>FoundationOne®Tracker</u> is a clinical test performed exclusively as a laboratory service. This test has not been cleared or approved by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA). FoundationOne Tracker is a personalized assay for oncology that is based on patient-specific somatic variants (substitutions and short insertions/deletions) identified from baseline tumor tissue testing and used to detect and longitudinally measure plasma circulating tumor DNA (ctDNA) abundance as a biomarker for tumor burden. Treatment decisions are the responsibility of the treating physician. ctDNA detection sensitivity may be limited if blood collection occurs within two weeks of surgery or while a patient is on therapy. A negative test result does not definitively indicate the absence of cancer. This test is not designed to detect or report germline variation, nor does it infer hereditary cancer risk for a patient. This test is designed to detect ctDNA from the assayed tumor only; new primary tumors will not be detected. This test is expected to have limited sensitivity in some cancer types due to limited ctDNA shed.</p></div>

      </div>
          
                              
      
      <div id="iss-tabpanel--3" role="tabpanel" aria-labelledby="iss-tab--3" tabindex="0" class="is-hidden c-tabs-vertical__item--rich-text t-white">
          
  <div class="o-wysiwyg--14 o-wysiwyg field field--name-field-isi field--type-text-long"><h3 class="h5"><strong>FoundationOne Liquid CDX</strong></h3><p>FoundationOne®Liquid CDx is for prescription use only and is a qualitative next-generation sequencing based <em>in vitro</em> diagnostic test for cancer patients with solid tumors. The test analyzes 324 genes utilizing circulating cell-free DNA and is FDA-approved to report short variants in 311 genes and as a companion diagnostic to identify patients who may benefit from treatment with specific therapies (listed in Table 1 of the Intended Use) in accordance with the approved therapeutic product labeling. Additional genomic findings may be reported and are not prescriptive or conclusive for labeled use of any specific therapeutic product. Use of the test does not guarantee a patient will be matched to a treatment. A negative result does not rule out the presence of an alteration. When considering eligibility for certain therapies for which FoundationOne Liquid CDx is a companion diagnostic, testing of plasma is only appropriate where tumor tissue is not available. Patients who are negative for other companion diagnostic mutations should be reflexed to tumor tissue testing and mutation status confirmed using an FDA-approved tumor tissue test, if feasible. For the complete label, including companion diagnostic indications and complete risk information, please visit <a href="http://www.f1lcdxlabel.com/">www.F1LCDxLabel.com</a>.</p></div>

      </div>
      </div>

</div>

</p>
            <br><a href="https://cookiepedia.co.uk/giving-consent-to-cookies" class="privacy-notice-link" rel="noopener" target="_blank" aria-label="More information about your privacy, opens in a new tab"> </a></p></div><div class="ot-desc-cntr ot-hide ot-always-active-group" role="tabpanel" tabindex="0" id="ot-desc-id-C0001"><div class="ot-grp-hdr1"><h4 class="ot-cat-header">Strictly Necessary Cookies</h4><div class="ot-tgl-cntr"><div class="ot-always-active">Always Active</div></div></div><p class="ot-grp-desc ot-category-desc">These cookies are necessary for the website to function and cannot be switched off in our systems. They are usually only set in response to actions made by you that amount to a request for services, such as setting your privacy preferences, logging in, or filling in forms. You can set your browser to block or alert you about these cookies, but blocking these cookies will prevent the site from working. These cookies do not store any personal information.</p></div><div class="ot-desc-cntr ot-hide" role="tabpanel" tabindex="0" id="ot-desc-id-BG2249"><div class="ot-grp-hdr1"><h4 class="ot-cat-header">Targeting & Social Media Cookies</h4><div class="ot-tgl"><input type="checkbox" name="ot-group-id-BG2249" id="ot-group-id-BG2249" role="switch" class="category-switch-handler" data-optanongroupid="BG2249" aria-labelledby="ot-header-id-BG2249"> <label class="ot-switch" for="ot-group-id-BG2249"><span class="ot-switch-nob"></span> <span class="ot-label-txt">Targeting & Social Media Cookies</span></label> </div><div class="ot-tgl-cntr"></div></div><p class="ot-grp-desc ot-category-desc">To personalize your specific preferences, use the toggle to turn the cookies "on" or "off".</p><div class="ot-subgrp-cntr"><ul class="ot-subgrps"><li class="ot-subgrp" data-optanongroupid="C0004"><h5>Targeting Cookies</h5><div class="ot-tgl-cntr ot-subgrp-tgl"><div class="ot-tgl ot-hide-tgl"><input type="checkbox" name="switch" id="ot-sub-group-id-C0004" role="switch" data-optanongroupid="C0004" class="cookie-subgroup-handler" aria-label="Targeting Cookies" aria-hidden="true"> <label class="ot-switch" for="ot-sub-group-id-C0004"><span class="ot-switch-nob"></span> <span class="ot-label-txt">Switch Label</span></label> <span class="ot-label-status">label</span></div></div><p class="ot-subgrp-desc">These cookies may be set through our site by our advertising partners. They may be used by those companies to build a profile of your interests and show you relevant advertisements on other sites. They do not store directly personal information, but are based on uniquely identifying your browser and internet device. If you do not allow these cookies, you will experience less targeted advertising.</p></li></ul></div></div><div class="ot-desc-cntr ot-hide" role="tabpanel" tabindex="0" id="ot-desc-id-C0003"><div class="ot-grp-hdr1"><h4 class="ot-cat-header">Functional Cookies</h4><div class="ot-tgl"><input type="checkbox" name="ot-group-id-C0003" id="ot-group-id-C0003" role="switch" class="category-switch-handler" data-optanongroupid="C0003" aria-labelledby="ot-header-id-C0003"> <label class="ot-switch" for="ot-group-id-C0003"><span class="ot-switch-nob"></span> <span class="ot-label-txt">Functional Cookies</span></label> </div><div class="ot-tgl-cntr"></div></div><p class="ot-grp-desc ot-category-desc">These cookies enable our websites to provide enhanced functionality and personalization. They may be set by us or by third party service providers whose services we have added to our pages. If you reject these cookies, then some or all of these services may not function properly.

</p></div><div class="ot-desc-cntr ot-hide" role="tabpanel" tabindex="0" id="ot-desc-id-C0002"><div class="ot-grp-hdr1"><h4 class="ot-cat-header">Performance Cookies</h4><div class="ot-tgl"><input type="checkbox" name="ot-group-id-C0002" id="ot-group-id-C0002" role="switch" class="category-switch-handler" data-optanongroupid="C0002" aria-labelledby="ot-header-id-C0002"> <label class="ot-switch" for="ot-group-id-C0002"><span class="ot-switch-nob"></span> <span class="ot-label-txt">Performance Cookies</span></label> </div><div class="ot-tgl-cntr"></div></div><p class="ot-grp-desc ot-category-desc"> These cookies allow us to count visits and traffic sources so we can measure and improve the performance of our site. They help us to know which pages are the most and least popular and see how visitors move around the site. We may collect your session ID, IP address, device identifiers, and your activity with the website. We may provide these cookies to third party service providers to help us run these analytics. If you block or opt out of these cookies, we will not know when you have visited our site, and will not be able to monitor its performance.
<p>
If you are located in Europe, the personal data may be sent to a country (e.g. United States) that has not been deemed to provide an adequate level of data protection or appropriate safeguards. By accepting these cookies, you consent to the data processing for analytics purposes and to the transfer of your personal data to the United States each time you visit our site.

          <h2>Ordering Overview</h2>
    
                      
  <div class="o-wysiwyg field field--name-field-text field--type-text-long"><p>Foundation Medicine tests must be ordered by a licensed physician. We offer multiple ways to order our tests:</p><ul><li><strong>Electronic Medical Record (EMR) Systems: </strong>our integrations with EMR systems, like <a href="/press-releases/a319c9ce-9025-4170-a376-de22b5c99481" title="">Epic®</a> and <a href="/press-releases/ba49795c-659b-4b11-9e4c-57faed61fda4" title="">OncoEMR®</a>, will allow you to place an order for a test directly through your practice's EMR system if enabled</li><li><strong>Foundation Medicine’s Online Portal: </strong><a href="https://home.foundationmedicine.com/login" title="">login</a> or <a href="https://home.foundationmedicine.com/signup" title="">sign up</a> for an online account</li><li><strong>Email or Fax:</strong> download or print our <a href="/media/409/fmi-view" data-entity-type="media" data-entity-uuid="d8d14e19-d04e-4b37-9f49-58b4c4387f2e" data-entity-substitution="fmi_media_fmi_canonical" title="Test Requisition Form (TRF)">Test Requisition Form</a>. Completed forms and associated attachments can be submitted via email to <a href="mailto:client.services@foundationmedicine.com" title="">client.services@foundationmedicine.com</a> or via fax to +1 (617) 418-2290</li></ul><p>If sending a solid tumor specimen, Foundation Medicine can complete the specimen retrieval process if requested on the order form (complete pathology lab information must be provided). If sending peripheral blood or bone marrow aspirate, please order the appropriate test kit with the form below to your practice and follow the specimen preparation instructions for liquid specimens.</p><p><strong>International Customers</strong>: To order, please visit <a href="https://www.rochefoundationmedicine.com/" title="">rochefoundationmedicine.com</a> or call +1 (888) 988-3639.</p></div>

              </div>
