  <section data-component-id="foundationmedicine:section" class="c-section vsp__none bsp__large">
  <div class="l-container">

          <div class="c-section__top ">
        <div class="c-section__top__inner">
                      <span class="js-jump-link">How to Order<a id="navAnchorId_1" href="#navAnchorId_1"></a></span>
          
                      <h2 class="">How to Order a Foundation Medicine Test</h2>
          
                        </div>
      </div>
    
    <div class="c-section__content">
            <div class="l-grid l-grid--100">

          <div class="layout__region layout__region--first l-paragraphs">
        




      
          
    
  
      
          
    
  
      
          
    
  



    
  
    
  
    
  
<div data-component-id="foundationmedicine:horizontal-tabs" class="c-tabs-horizontal js-tabs" data-once="foundationmedicineTabs">
  <div class="c-tabs-horizontal__sidebar">
    <div role="tablist" aria-orientation="horizontal" class="c-tabs-horizontal__tabs u-display--desktop" aria-labelledby="tablist--2">
              <button id="tab--4" class="o-btn o-btn--tertiary" type="button" role="tab" aria-selected="true" aria-controls="tabpanel--4">
            Solid Specimen Ordering Process
        </button>
              <button id="tab--5" class="o-btn o-btn--tertiary" type="button" role="tab" aria-selected="false" aria-controls="tabpanel--5" tabindex="-1">
            Liquid Specimen Ordering Process
        </button>
              <button id="tab--6" class="o-btn o-btn--tertiary" type="button" role="tab" aria-selected="false" aria-controls="tabpanel--6" tabindex="-1">
            Monitoring Ordering Process
        </button>
          </div>

        <div class="c-dropdown u-display--mobile" data-once="fmiDropdown">
	<select class="c-dropdown__native js-dropdown-native" aria-labelledby="tablist--2">
		
									<option value="tabpanel--4">Solid Specimen Ordering Process</option>
							<option value="tabpanel--5">Liquid Specimen Ordering Process</option>
							<option value="tabpanel--6">Monitoring Ordering Process</option>
						</select>

	
</div>


  </div>

  <div class="c-tabs-horizontal__content">
          
                              
      
      <div id="tabpanel--4" role="tabpanel" aria-labelledby="tab--4" tabindex="0" class="c-tabs-horizontal__item--rich-text t-white">
          <div class="paragraph paragraph--type--tabs-item-horizontal paragraph--view-mode--default">
            


<div class="o-wysiwyg">
    <p>If you will be sending an FFPE block or unstained slides to Foundation Medicine for testing with FoundationOne<sup>®</sup>CDx or FoundationOne<sup>®</sup>Heme, please follow the instructions below:</p><ol><li>Place a test order through your EMR system if enabled or order online by <a href="https://home.foundationmedicine.com/login" title="">logging in</a> or <a href="https://home.foundationmedicine.com/signup" title="">signing-up</a> for a Foundation Medicine account. Orders can also be submitted via <a href="mailto:client.services@foundationmedicine.com" title="">email</a> or fax using our<a href="/media/409/fmi-view" data-entity-type="media" data-entity-uuid="d8d14e19-d04e-4b37-9f49-58b4c4387f2e" data-entity-substitution="fmi_media_fmi_canonical" title="Test Requisition Form (TRF)"> Test Requisition Form</a>.</li><li>Complete the order form, provide any required attachments including Advanced Beneficiary Notice if needed, and submit. Some pathology labs require patient consent prior to releasing a specimen for testing, so providing us with a completed <a href="/media/362/fmi-view" data-entity-type="media" data-entity-uuid="5fb7f2e3-8fd7-4b27-97f0-e61d8b7f11e8" data-entity-substitution="fmi_media_fmi_canonical" title="Specimen Release Consent Form">Specimen Release Consent Form</a> up front can help avoid potential order delays.</li><li>Foundation Medicine will contact the pathologist if requested during the ordering process with instructions for sample procurement and shipment. If you will be arranging for specimen shipment yourself, please do so after submitting the order form. To request a Specimen Shipping Kit please contact <a href="mailto:client.services@foundationmedicine.com" title="">client services</a> or fill out our Order a Shipping Kit form below.</li><li>You will receive online or printed results typically 8 days or less from receipt of specimen for FoundationOne CDx.</li></ol><p> </p>

</div>


      </div>

      </div>
          
                              
      
      <div id="tabpanel--5" role="tabpanel" aria-labelledby="tab--5" tabindex="0" class="is-hidden c-tabs-horizontal__item--rich-text t-white">
          <div class="paragraph paragraph--type--tabs-item-horizontal paragraph--view-mode--default">
            


<div class="o-wysiwyg">
    <p>If you will be sending peripheral whole blood or bone marrow aspirate to Foundation Medicine for testing with FoundationOne<sup>®</sup>Liquid CDx or FoundationOne<sup>®</sup>Heme, please follow the instructions below:</p><ol><li>Place a test order through your EMR if enabled or order online by <a href="https://home.foundationmedicine.com/login" title="">logging in</a> or <a href="https://home.foundationmedicine.com/signup" title="">signing-up</a> for a Foundation Medicine account. Orders can also be submitted via <a href="mailto:client.services@foundationmedicine.com" title="">email</a> or fax using our<a href="/media/409/fmi-view" data-entity-type="media" data-entity-uuid="d8d14e19-d04e-4b37-9f49-58b4c4387f2e" data-entity-substitution="fmi_media_fmi_canonical" title="Test Requisition Form (TRF)"> Test Requisition Form</a>.</li><li>Complete the order form, provide any required attachments including Advanced Beneficiary Notice if needed, and submit.</li><li>If collecting the sample in-office, request a Specimen Shipping Kit to your practice using the form below or by contacting our client services team. Mobile phlebotomy is also available for patients if preferred.</li><li>Once the kit arrives, collect the blood or bone marrow sample from your patient per the specimen instructions for the appropriate test and label tubes with two patient-specific identifiers.</li><li>Send the sample overnight to Foundation Medicine using the FedEx pack included in the kit.</li><li>You will receive online or printed results typically 7 days or less from receipt of specimen for FoundationOne Liquid CDx.</li></ol><p> </p>

</div>


      </div>

      </div>
          
                              
      
      <div id="tabpanel--6" role="tabpanel" aria-labelledby="tab--6" tabindex="0" class="is-hidden c-tabs-horizontal__item--rich-text t-white">
          <div class="paragraph paragraph--type--tabs-item-horizontal paragraph--view-mode--default">
            


<div class="o-wysiwyg">
    <p class="p1">FoundationOne<sup>®</sup>Tracker can be added to any prior FoundationOne<sup>®</sup>CDx test with results reported August 20, 2019, or later. Alternatively, FoundationOne Tracker can be ordered together with a new FoundationOne CDx test. Please follow the instructions below to place an order in the Foundation Medicine portal:</p><ol><li><p class="p1">Place a test order through your EMR system if enabled or order online by logging in or signing-up for a Foundation Medicine account.</p></li><li><p class="p1">If you need to create an account, visit foundationmedicine.com and click on the "Create an Account" link in the upper right corner of the screen.</p></li><li><p class="p1">Once your account is confirmed, click "Order a Test" from the homepage. You will be prompted to select which test type you would like to order - either a Monitoring Test or a Genomic Profiling Test. Click "Monitoring".</p></li><li><p class="p1">In the "Patient Information" section you will be able to enter your patient's details. If the patient has already had a Foundation Medicine test, you can select their name from the dropdown menu that appears. By selecting the patient from the list, their test history and information will automatically populate. This step is necessary to link an existing FoundationOne CDx baseline test to a FoundationOne Tracker Monitoring Series.</p><p class="p1">- If the patient does not have a previous FoundationOne CDx test eligible to add FoundationOne Tracker, please select the FoundationOne CDx + FoundationOne Tracker option to place these orders together.</p></li><li><p class="p1">Complete the order form, provide any required attachments including Advanced Beneficiary Notice if needed, and submit.</p></li></ol>

</div>


      </div>

      </div>
      </div>

</div>

      </div>
    
  </div>

      </div>

  </div>
</section>
</div>

      <div class="c-media-card__body t-white">
        
        <div class="c-media-card__text-content u-sp__mb--1-5">
                    
  <div class="o-wysiwyg--14 o-wysiwyg field field--name-field-text field--type-text-long"><p>We know how important efficiency is for your clinical workflow. That’s why we’re partnering with EMR systems like <a href="/press-releases/a319c9ce-9025-4170-a376-de22b5c99481">Epic</a> and <a href="/press-releases/ba49795c-659b-4b11-9e4c-57faed61fda4">OncoEMR</a> to integrate our comprehensive genomic profiling (CGP) tests and our other testing services into your practices’ workflow. Once enabled, our EMR integrations allow providers to place orders for our CGP tests and receive and view test results directly within their existing workflow.</p><p>To learn more about our EMR integrations, please contact your Commercial Program Manager or reach out to our Client Services team at <a href="mailto:client.services@foundationmedicine.com">client.services@foundationmedicine.com</a> or +1 (888) 988-3639.</p></div>

</div>




    
  
  

<div data-component-id="foundationmedicine:media-card" class="c-media-card c-media-card--o-image-right">
  <div class="c-media-card__inner">

    <div class="c-media-card__media">
      <article class="media media--type-image media--view-mode-_-5">
  
      
  <div class="field field--name-field-media-image field--type-image field--label-visually_hidden">

          <h2>Portfolio Reflex Option</h2>
    
                      
  <div class="o-wysiwyg--12 o-wysiwyg field field--name-field-text field--type-text-long"><p>We offer the option to automatically reflex between tissue and liquid sample types using our FDA-approved Portfolio of FoundationOne CDx and FoundationOne Liquid CDx. If the "Portfolio Reflex" option is selected during the online ordering process or on our Test Requisition Form, we will proceed with the initial CGP test selected and if the specimen does not meet the criteria for successful testing, we will automatically reflex to the other test and procure a new specimen. The failed test is not billed, and the successful test will be billed according to our standard practices.</p></div>

      <div id="iss-tabpanel--1" role="tabpanel" aria-labelledby="iss-tab--1" tabindex="0" class="c-tabs-vertical__item--rich-text t-white">
          
  <div class="o-wysiwyg--14 o-wysiwyg field field--name-field-isi field--type-text-long"><h3 class="h5">FoundationOne CDx</h3><p>FoundationOne®CDx is a qualitative next-generation sequencing based in vitro diagnostic test for cancer patients with solid tumors and is for prescription use only. The test analyzes 324 genes as well as genomic signatures including microsatellite instability (MSI) and tumor mutational burden (TMB) and is a companion diagnostic to identify patients who may benefit from treatment with specific therapies in accordance with the approved therapeutic product labeling. Additional genomic findings may be reported and are not prescriptive or conclusive for labeled use of any specific therapeutic product. Use of the test does not guarantee a patient will be matched to a treatment. A negative result does not rule out the presence of an alteration. Some patients may require a biopsy. For the complete label, including companion diagnostic indications and important risk information, please visit <a href="http://www.F1CDxLabel.com">www.F1CDxLabel.com</a></p></div>

      </div>
          
                              
      
      <div id="iss-tabpanel--2" role="tabpanel" aria-labelledby="iss-tab--2" tabindex="0" class="is-hidden c-tabs-vertical__item--rich-text t-white">
          
  <div class="o-wysiwyg--14 o-wysiwyg field field--name-field-isi field--type-text-long"><h3 class="h5">FoundationOne Tracker</h3><p><u>FoundationOne®Tracker</u> is a clinical test performed exclusively as a laboratory service. This test has not been cleared or approved by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA). FoundationOne Tracker is a personalized assay for oncology that is based on patient-specific somatic variants (substitutions and short insertions/deletions) identified from baseline tumor tissue testing and used to detect and longitudinally measure plasma circulating tumor DNA (ctDNA) abundance as a biomarker for tumor burden. Treatment decisions are the responsibility of the treating physician. ctDNA detection sensitivity may be limited if blood collection occurs within two weeks of surgery or while a patient is on therapy. A negative test result does not definitively indicate the absence of cancer. This test is not designed to detect or report germline variation, nor does it infer hereditary cancer risk for a patient. This test is designed to detect ctDNA from the assayed tumor only; new primary tumors will not be detected. This test is expected to have limited sensitivity in some cancer types due to limited ctDNA shed.</p></div>

      </div>
          
                              
      
      <div id="iss-tabpanel--3" role="tabpanel" aria-labelledby="iss-tab--3" tabindex="0" class="is-hidden c-tabs-vertical__item--rich-text t-white">
          
  <div class="o-wysiwyg--14 o-wysiwyg field field--name-field-isi field--type-text-long"><h3 class="h5"><strong>FoundationOne Liquid CDX</strong></h3><p>FoundationOne®Liquid CDx is for prescription use only and is a qualitative next-generation sequencing based <em>in vitro</em> diagnostic test for cancer patients with solid tumors. The test analyzes 324 genes utilizing circulating cell-free DNA and is FDA-approved to report short variants in 311 genes and as a companion diagnostic to identify patients who may benefit from treatment with specific therapies (listed in Table 1 of the Intended Use) in accordance with the approved therapeutic product labeling. Additional genomic findings may be reported and are not prescriptive or conclusive for labeled use of any specific therapeutic product. Use of the test does not guarantee a patient will be matched to a treatment. A negative result does not rule out the presence of an alteration. When considering eligibility for certain therapies for which FoundationOne Liquid CDx is a companion diagnostic, testing of plasma is only appropriate where tumor tissue is not available. Patients who are negative for other companion diagnostic mutations should be reflexed to tumor tissue testing and mutation status confirmed using an FDA-approved tumor tissue test, if feasible. For the complete label, including companion diagnostic indications and complete risk information, please visit <a href="http://www.f1lcdxlabel.com/">www.F1LCDxLabel.com</a>.</p></div>

      </div>
      </div>

</div>
  
</div>
</div>

These cookies do not store any personal information.</p></div><div class="ot-desc-cntr ot-hide" role="tabpanel" tabindex="0" id="ot-desc-id-BG2249"><div class="ot-grp-hdr1"><h4 class="ot-cat-header">Targeting & Social Media Cookies</h4><div class="ot-tgl"><input type="checkbox" name="ot-group-id-BG2249" id="ot-group-id-BG2249" role="switch" class="category-switch-handler" data-optanongroupid="BG2249" aria-labelledby="ot-header-id-BG2249"> <label class="ot-switch" for="ot-group-id-BG2249"><span class="ot-switch-nob"></span> <span class="ot-label-txt">Targeting & Social Media Cookies</span></label> </div><div class="ot-tgl-cntr"></div></div><p class="ot-grp-desc ot-category-desc">To personalize your specific preferences, use the toggle to turn the cookies "on" or "off".</p><div class="ot-subgrp-cntr"><ul class="ot-subgrps"><li class="ot-subgrp" data-optanongroupid="C0004"><h5>Targeting Cookies</h5><div class="ot-tgl-cntr ot-subgrp-tgl"><div class="ot-tgl ot-hide-tgl"><input type="checkbox" name="switch" id="ot-sub-group-id-C0004" role="switch" data-optanongroupid="C0004" class="cookie-subgroup-handler" aria-label="Targeting Cookies" aria-hidden="true"> <label class="ot-switch" for="ot-sub-group-id-C0004"><span class="ot-switch-nob"></span> <span class="ot-label-txt">Switch Label</span></label> <span class="ot-label-status">label</span></div></div><p class="ot-subgrp-desc">These cookies may be set through our site by our advertising partners. They may be used by those companies to build a profile of your interests and show you relevant advertisements on other sites. They do not store directly personal information, but are based on uniquely identifying your browser and internet device. If you do not allow these cookies, you will experience less targeted advertising.</p></li></ul></div></div><div class="ot-desc-cntr ot-hide" role="tabpanel" tabindex="0" id="ot-desc-id-C0003"><div class="ot-grp-hdr1"><h4 class="ot-cat-header">Functional Cookies</h4><div class="ot-tgl"><input type="checkbox" name="ot-group-id-C0003" id="ot-group-id-C0003" role="switch" class="category-switch-handler" data-optanongroupid="C0003" aria-labelledby="ot-header-id-C0003"> <label class="ot-switch" for="ot-group-id-C0003"><span class="ot-switch-nob"></span> <span class="ot-label-txt">Functional Cookies</span></label> </div><div class="ot-tgl-cntr"></div></div><p class="ot-grp-desc ot-category-desc">These cookies enable our websites to provide enhanced functionality and personalization. They may be set by us or by third party service providers whose services we have added to our pages. If you reject these cookies, then some or all of these services may not function properly.

</p></div><div class="ot-desc-cntr ot-hide" role="tabpanel" tabindex="0" id="ot-desc-id-C0002"><div class="ot-grp-hdr1"><h4 class="ot-cat-header">Performance Cookies</h4><div class="ot-tgl"><input type="checkbox" name="ot-group-id-C0002" id="ot-group-id-C0002" role="switch" class="category-switch-handler" data-optanongroupid="C0002" aria-labelledby="ot-header-id-C0002"> <label class="ot-switch" for="ot-group-id-C0002"><span class="ot-switch-nob"></span> <span class="ot-label-txt">Performance Cookies</span></label> </div><div class="ot-tgl-cntr"></div></div><p class="ot-grp-desc ot-category-desc"> These cookies allow us to count visits and traffic sources so we can measure and improve the performance of our site. They help us to know which pages are the most and least popular and see how visitors move around the site. We may collect your session ID, IP address, device identifiers, and your activity with the website. We may provide these cookies to third party service providers to help us run these analytics. If you block or opt out of these cookies, we will not know when you have visited our site, and will not be able to monitor its performance.
<p>
If you are located in Europe, the personal data may be sent to a country (e.g. United States) that has not been deemed to provide an adequate level of data protection or appropriate safeguards. By accepting these cookies, you consent to the data processing for analytics purposes and to the transfer of your personal data to the United States each time you visit our site.

message.text: for custom salesforce objects can you create a list view in metadata?

parts.text: for custom salesforce objects can you create a list view in metadata?

response.value:
Yes, you can create a list view for custom Salesforce objects using metadata. You need to define the list view in the object's metadata file. Here is an example of how to create a list view for a custom object called `MyCustomObject__c`.

First, create or update the metadata file for the custom object, typically located in the `objects` directory, e.g., `objects/MyCustomObject__c.object`.

Here is an example of how to define a list view in the metadata file:

```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<CustomObject xmlns="http://soap.sforce.com/2006/04/metadata">
    <label>My Custom Object</label>
    <pluralLabel>My Custom Objects</pluralLabel>
    <nameField>
        <label>My Custom Object Name</label>
        <type>Text</type>
    </nameField>
    <deploymentStatus>Deployed</deploymentStatus>
    <sharingModel>ReadWrite</sharingModel>
    <listViews>
        <fullName>My_Custom_List_View</fullName>
        <label>My Custom List View</label>
        <filterScope>Everything</filterScope>
        <filters>
            <field>MyField__c</field>
            <operation>equals</operation>
            <value>SomeValue</value>
        </filters>
        <columns>
            <field>MyField__c</field>
        </columns>
        <columns>
            <field>AnotherField__c</field>
        </columns>
    </listViews>
</CustomObject>
```

In this example:
- `<fullName>`: The unique name of the list view.
- `<label>`: The display name of the list view.
- `<filterScope>`: The scope of the filter (e.g., `Everything`, `Mine`, `Queue`, etc.).
- `<filters>`: The criteria for filtering records in the list view.
- `<columns>`: The fields to display in the list view.

After defining the list view, deploy the metadata to your Salesforce org using a tool like Salesforce CLI or an IDE with Salesforce integration.

For example, using Salesforce CLI, you can deploy the metadata with the following command:

```sh
sfdx force:source:deploy -p path/to/objects/MyCustomObject__c.object
```

Replace `path/to/objects/MyCustomObject__c.object` with the actual path to your metadata file.

To include the specified columns in the [`All.listView-meta.xml`](command:_github.copilot.openRelativePath?%5B%7B%22scheme%22%3A%22file%22%2C%22authority%22%3A%22%22%2C%22path%22%3A%22%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOMS%2Fforce-app%2Fmain%2Fdefault%2Fobjects%2FOrdering_Account__c%2FlistViews%2FAll.listView-meta.xml%22%2C%22query%22%3A%22%22%2C%22fragment%22%3A%22%22%7D%5D "/Users/thbui/Documents/Salesforce/OMS/force-app/main/default/objects/Ordering_Account__c/listViews/All.listView-meta.xml") file for the patient object, you need to add the `columns` element with the appropriate `field` elements. Here is the updated content for the file:

```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<ListView xmlns="http://soap.sforce.com/2006/04/metadata">
    <fullName>All</fullName>
    <filterScope>Everything</filterScope>
    <label>All</label>
    <columns>
        <field>FirstName__c</field>
        <field>LastName__c</field>
        <field>DOB__c</field>
        <field>Sex__c</field>
        <field>MI__c</field>
        <field>Address__c</field>
        <field>City__c</field>
        <field>State__c</field>
        <field>ZipCode__c</field>
    </columns>
</ListView>
```

This will include all the columns from the [`patientColumns`](command:_github.copilot.openSymbolFromReferences?%5B%22patientColumns%22%2C%5B%7B%22uri%22%3A%7B%22%24mid%22%3A1%2C%22fsPath%22%3A%22%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOMS%2Fforce-app%2Fmain%2Fdefault%2Flwc%2ForderForm%2ForderForm.js%22%2C%22external%22%3A%22file%3A%2F%2F%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOMS%2Fforce-app%2Fmain%2Fdefault%2Flwc%2ForderForm%2ForderForm.js%22%2C%22path%22%3A%22%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOMS%2Fforce-app%2Fmain%2Fdefault%2Flwc%2ForderForm%2ForderForm.js%22%2C%22scheme%22%3A%22file%22%7D%2C%22pos%22%3A%7B%22line%22%3A192%2C%22character%22%3A4%7D%7D%5D%5D "Go to definition") array except for the 'ID' field.

response.value:
To include the list views for the `Patient__c`, `Physician__c`, and `Ordering_Account__c` objects, you need to create or update the list view metadata files for each object. Here are the updated contents for each list view metadata file:

### Patient__c List View (`All.listView-meta.xml`)
```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<ListView xmlns="http://soap.sforce.com/2006/04/metadata">
    <fullName>All</fullName>
    <filterScope>Everything</filterScope>
    <label>All</label>
    <columns>
        <field>FirstName__c</field>
        <field>LastName__c</field>
        <field>DOB__c</field>
        <field>Sex__c</field>
        <field>MI__c</field>
        <field>Address__c</field>
        <field>City__c</field>
        <field>State__c</field>
        <field>ZipCode__c</field>
    </columns>
</ListView>
```

### Physician__c List View (`All.listView-meta.xml`)
```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<ListView xmlns="http://soap.sforce.com/2006/04/metadata">
    <fullName>All</fullName>
    <filterScope>Everything</filterScope>
    <label>All</label>
    <columns>
        <field>FirstName__c</field>
        <field>LastName__c</field>
        <field>Phone__c</field>
        <field>Email__c</field>
        <field>NPI__c</field>
    </columns>
</ListView>
```

### Ordering_Account__c List View (`All.listView-meta.xml`)
```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<ListView xmlns="http://soap.sforce.com/2006/04/metadata">
    <fullName>All</fullName>
    <filterScope>Everything</filterScope>
    <label>All</label>
    <columns>
        <field>FirstName__c</field>
        <field>LastName__c</field>
        <field>DOB__c</field>
        <field>Sex__c</field>
        <field>MI__c</field>
        <field>Address__c</field>
        <field>City__c</field>
        <field>State__c</field>
        <field>ZipCode__c</field>
    </columns>
</ListView>
```

Make sure to place each XML content in the respective file paths for the objects:

```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<CustomObject xmlns="http://soap.sforce.com/2006/04/metadata">
    <actionOverrides>
        <actionName>Accept</actionName>
        <type>Default</type>
    </actionOverrides>
    <!-- Other actionOverrides elements -->
    <allowInChatterGroups>false</allowInChatterGroups>
    <compactLayoutAssignment>SYSTEM</compactLayoutAssignment>
    <deploymentStatus>Deployed</deploymentStatus>
    <enableActivities>false</enableActivities>
    <enableBulkApi>true</enableBulkApi>
    <enableFeeds>false</enableFeeds>
    <enableHistory>true</enableHistory>
    <enableLicensing>false</enableLicensing>
    <enableReports>false</enableReports>
    <enableSearch>false</enableSearch>
    <enableSharing>true</enableSharing>
    <enableStreamingApi>true</enableStreamingApi>
    <externalSharingModel>Private</externalSharingModel>
    <label>Patient</label>
    <nameField>
        <displayFormat>PAT-{00000}</displayFormat>
        <label>Patient Name</label>
        <trackHistory>false</trackHistory>
        <type>AutoNumber</type>
    </nameField>
    <pluralLabel>Patients</pluralLabel>
    <searchLayouts></searchLayouts>
    <sharingModel>ReadWrite</sharingModel>
    <visibility>Public</visibility>
    <!-- Ensure fields are within the <fields> section -->
    <fields>
        <fullName>FirstName__c</fullName>
        <label>First Name</label>
        <type>Text</type>
    </fields>
    <fields>
        <fullName>LastName__c</fullName>
        <label>Last Name</label>
        <type>Text</type>
    </fields>
    <fields>
        <fullName>DOB__c</fullName>
        <label>Date of Birth</label>
        <type>Date</type>
    </fields>
    <fields>
        <fullName>Sex__c</fullName>
        <label>Sex</label>
        <type>Picklist</type>
        <picklist>
            <picklistValues>
                <fullName>Male</fullName>
                <default>false</default>
            </picklistValues>
            <picklistValues>
                <fullName>Female</fullName>
                <default>false</default>
            </picklistValues>
        </picklist>
    </fields>
    <fields>
        <fullName>MI__c</fullName>
        <label>Middle Initial</label>
        <type>Text</type>
    </fields>
    <fields>
        <fullName>Address__c</fullName>
        <label>Address</label>
        <type>Text</type>
    </fields>
    <fields>
        <fullName>City__c</fullName>
        <label>City</label>
        <type>Text</type>
    </fields>
    <fields>

        <type>Text</type>
    </fields>
    <fields>

        <label>Zip Code</label>
        <type>Text</type>
    </fields>
    <fields>
        <fullName>Treating_Physician_Information__c</fullName>
        <label>Treating Physician Information</label>
        <type>Lookup</type>
        <referenceTo>Physician__c</referenceTo>
    </fields>
    <fields>
        <fullName>Ordering_Account__c</fullName>
        <label>Ordering Account</label>
        <type>Lookup</type>
        <referenceTo>Account</referenceTo>
    </fields>
    <fields>
        <fullName>PatientToOrder__c</fullName>
        <label>Patient to Order</label>
        <type>Lookup</type>
        <referenceTo>Order__c</referenceTo>
    </fields>
</CustomObject>
```

### Explanation:
- Each field is defined within its own `<fields>` element.
- The `<fullName>`, `<label>`, and `<type>` elements are specified for each field.
- For picklist fields, the `<picklist>` and `<picklistValues>` elements are included.
- For lookup fields, the `<referenceTo>` element is included to specify the related object.

```sh

```

message.text: in soql what is the purpose of putting % around a searchterm

parts.text: in soql what is the purpose of putting % around a searchterm

response.value:
In SOQL (Salesforce Object Query Language), the `%` symbol is used as a wildcard character in [`LIKE`](command:_github.copilot.openSymbolFromReferences?%5B%22LIKE%22%2C%5B%7B%22uri%22%3A%7B%22%24mid%22%3A1%2C%22fsPath%22%3A%22%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOMS%2Fforce-app%2Fmain%2Fdefault%2Fclasses%2FQueryController.cls%22%2C%22external%22%3A%22file%3A%2F%2F%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOMS%2Fforce-app%2Fmain%2Fdefault%2Fclasses%2FQueryController.cls%22%2C%22path%22%3A%22%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOMS%2Fforce-app%2Fmain%2Fdefault%2Fclasses%2FQueryController.cls%22%2C%22scheme%22%3A%22file%22%7D%2C%22pos%22%3A%7B%22line%22%3A5%2C%22character%22%3A41%7D%7D%5D%5D "Go to definition") clauses. It allows for pattern matching within string fields. When you put `%` around a search term, it means that you are looking for records where the specified field contains the search term anywhere within it.

For example:
- `%term%` matches any string that contains "term".
- `term%` matches any string that starts with "term".
- `%term` matches any string that ends with "term".

[`physicianSearchTerm`](command:_github.copilot.openSymbolFromReferences?%5B%22physicianSearchTerm%22%2C%5B%7B%22uri%22%3A%7B%22%24mid%22%3A1%2C%22fsPath%22%3A%22%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOMS%2Fforce-app%2Fmain%2Fdefault%2Fclasses%2FQueryController.cls%22%2C%22external%22%3A%22file%3A%2F%2F%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOMS%2Fforce-app%2Fmain%2Fdefault%2Fclasses%2FQueryController.cls%22%2C%22path%22%3A%22%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOMS%2Fforce-app%2Fmain%2Fdefault%2Fclasses%2FQueryController.cls%22%2C%22scheme%22%3A%22file%22%7D%2C%22pos%22%3A%7B%22line%22%3A13%2C%22character%22%3A92%7D%7D%5D%5D message.text: How can I enable debug logs in Salesforce?

parts.text: How can I enable debug logs in Salesforce?

response.value:
To enable debug logs in Salesforce, follow these steps:

1. **Log in to Salesforce**: Go to your Salesforce instance and log in with your credentials.

2. **Navigate to Setup**: Click on the gear icon in the top right corner and select "Setup".

3. **Search for Debug Logs**: In the Quick Find box on the left, type "Debug Logs" and select "Debug Logs" under the "Logs" section.

4. **Set Up Debug Logs**:
    - Click on the "New" button.
    - Select the user for whom you want to enable debug logs.
    - Set the start and expiration date/time for the debug logs.
    - Click "Save".

5. **Configure Trace Flags**:
    - Click on "New" under "Trace Flags".
    - Select the entity (e.g., User) and the user for whom you want to set the trace flag.
    - Set the start and expiration date/time.
    - Choose the debug level (e.g., "Apex Code", "Apex Profiling", "Callout", "Database", etc.).
    - Click "Save".

6. **View Debug Logs**:
    - After performing the actions you want to debug, return to the "Debug Logs" page.
    - Click "View" next to the log entry to see the details.

This will enable and configure debug logs for the specified user, allowing you to capture detailed logs for troubleshooting and debugging purposes.

response.value:
To ensure that the debug logs are set up for the user executing the methods in Salesforce, follow these steps:

1. **Log in to Salesforce**: Go to your Salesforce instance and log in with your credentials.

2. **Navigate to Setup**: Click on the gear icon in the top right corner and select "Setup".

3. **Search for Debug Logs**: In the Quick Find box on the left, type "Debug Logs" and select "Debug Logs" under the "Logs" section.

4. **Set Up Debug Logs for the User**:
    - Click on the "New" button.
    - In the "Traced Entity Type" dropdown, select "User".
    - In the "Traced Entity Name" dropdown, select the user who will be executing the methods. This should be the user account that is running the Apex code.
    - Set the start and expiration date/time for the debug logs.
    - Click "Save".

5. **Configure Trace Flags**:
    - Click on "New" under "Trace Flags".
    - Select the entity (e.g., User) and the user for whom you want to set the trace flag.
    - Set the start and expiration date/time.
    - Choose the debug level (e.g., "Apex Code", "Apex Profiling", "Callout", "Database", etc.).
    - Click "Save".

By setting up the debug logs for the specific user who is executing the methods, you ensure that all debug statements and logs generated by that user's actions are captured. This helps in troubleshooting and debugging the code effectively.

message.text: do dependencies for the class matter

parts.text: do dependencies for the class matter

response.value:
Yes, dependencies for the class do matter. If the class `QueryController` or its methods depend on other classes, objects, or fields that are not properly defined or accessible, it can cause issues when trying to execute the methods. Here are some key points to consider:

1. **Class Dependencies**:
    - Ensure that any classes or methods called within `QueryController` are properly defined and accessible.
    - Check for any circular dependencies that might cause issues.

2. **Object and Field Access**:
    - Ensure that the objects and fields being queried in the methods are accessible to the user executing the code.
    - Verify that the field-level security settings allow access to the fields being queried.

3. **User Permissions**:
    - Ensure that the user has the necessary permissions to execute the Apex class and access the data.
    - Check the user's profile and permission sets to ensure they have access to the required objects and fields.

4. **Namespace Prefix**:
    - If you are working in a managed package, ensure that you are using the correct namespace prefix when referencing objects and fields.

5. **Compilation and Deployment**:
    - Ensure that the class has been successfully compiled and deployed to the Salesforce org.
    - Check for any compilation errors that might prevent the class from being properly deployed.

6. **API Version**:
    - Ensure that the API version of the Apex class is compatible with the features and methods being used.

### Example of Checking Dependencies in `QueryController`:

```apex
public with sharing class QueryController {
    @AuraEnabled
    public static List<Patient__c> searchPatientAccounts(String patientSearchTerm) {
        try {
            System.debug('searchPatientAccount' + patientSearchTerm);
            String searchTerm = '%' + patientSearchTerm + '%';
            String query = 'SELECT Name, Id, firstName__c, mi__c, lastName__c, dob__c, sex__c, mrn__c, address__c, city__c, country__c, zipCode__c, phone__c, state__c, email__c, Treating_Physician_Information__c, Ordering_Account__c FROM Patient__c WHERE ' +
                           'firstName__c LIKE :searchTerm OR lastName__c LIKE :searchTerm or address__c LIKE: searchTerm or email__c LIKE:searchTerm or mrn__c LIKE: searchTerm';
            return Database.query(query);
        } catch (Exception e) {
            throw new AuraHandledException(e.getMessage());
        }
    }
}
```

### Steps to Verify Dependencies:

1. **Check Object and Field Definitions**:
    - Ensure that `Patient__c`, `Treating_Physician_Information__c`, and `Ordering_Account__c` objects and their fields are properly defined in your Salesforce org.

2. **Check Field-Level Security**:
    - Go to Setup -> Object Manager -> [Object Name] -> Fields & Relationships.
    - Ensure that the fields being queried are accessible to the user.

3. **Check User Permissions**:
    - Go to Setup -> Users -> [User Name] -> Profile.
    - Ensure that the profile has the necessary permissions to access the objects and fields.

4. **Check for Compilation Errors**:
    - Go to Setup -> Apex Classes.
    - Ensure that the `QueryController` class is listed without any errors.

By ensuring that all dependencies are properly defined and accessible, you can avoid issues related to missing or inaccessible Apex actions.

If you are encountering the error "No apex action available for QueryController.searchPatientAccounts," it indicates that the Lightning component or JavaScript code is unable to find or call the specified Apex method. Here are some steps to troubleshoot and resolve this issue:

1. Ensure Apex Method is Annotated Correctly
Make sure the searchPatientAccounts method in QueryController is annotated with @AuraEnabled and is public.

2. Verify Deployment
Ensure that the QueryController class has been successfully deployed to your Salesforce org. You can do this by checking the Apex Classes in Setup.

3. Check User Permissions
Ensure that the user has the necessary permissions to execute the Apex method and access the data. This includes:

Profile permissions to execute Apex classes.
Field-level security for the fields being queried.
4. Correctly Reference the Apex Method in JavaScript
Ensure that the JavaScript code correctly references the Apex method. Here is an example of how to call the searchPatientAccounts method from a Lightning Web Component (LWC):

JavaScript (orderForm.js)
5. Check for Namespace Prefix
If you are working in a managed package, ensure that you are using the correct namespace prefix when calling the Apex method.

parts.text: sales force make a field viewable in the tab

message.text: sales force make a field viewable in the tab

response.value:
To make a field viewable in a tab in Salesforce, you need to add the field to the page layout for the object. Here are the steps to do this:

1. **Navigate to Object Manager:**
   - Go to `Setup` in Salesforce.
   - In the Quick Find box, type `Object Manager` and select it.

2. **Select the Object:**
   - Find and select the object you want to modify (e.g., `Account`, `Contact`, [`Custom Object`](command:_github.copilot.openSymbolFromReferences?%5B%22Custom%20Object%22%2C%5B%7B%22uri%22%3A%7B%22%24mid%22%3A1%2C%22fsPath%22%3A%22%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOMS%2Fforce-app%2Fmain%2Fdefault%2Flwc%2ForderForm%2ForderForm.js%22%2C%22external%22%3A%22file%3A%2F%2F%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOMS%2Fforce-app%2Fmain%2Fdefault%2Flwc%2ForderForm%2ForderForm.js%22%2C%22path%22%3A%22%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOMS%2Fforce-app%2Fmain%2Fdefault%2Flwc%2ForderForm%2ForderForm.js%22%2C%22scheme%22%3A%22file%22%7D%2C%22pos%22%3A%7B%22line%22%3A517%2C%22character%22%3A16%7D%7D%5D%5D "Go to definition")).

3. **Edit the Page Layout:**
   - In the left-hand sidebar, click on `Page Layouts`.
   - Select the page layout you want to edit.

4. **Add the Field to the Layout:**
   - In the page layout editor, find the field you want to add in the palette at the top.
   - Drag and drop the field into the desired section of the layout.

5. **Save the Layout:**
   - Click `Save` to apply the changes.

### Example: Adding a Field to the Account Page Layout

1. Go to `Setup`.
2. Type `Object Manager` in the Quick Find box and select it.
3. Select `Account` from the list of objects.
4. Click on `Page Layouts` in the left-hand sidebar.
5. Select the `Account Layout` (or the layout you want to modify).
6. In the page layout editor, find the field you want to add in the palette.
7. Drag and drop the field into the desired section.
8. Click `Save`.

This will make the field viewable in the tab for the specified object.

id%22%3A1%2C%22fsPath%22%3A%22%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOMS%2Fforce-app%2Fmain%2Fdefault%2Fprofiles%2Fchat.json%22%2C%22external%22%3A%22file%3A%2F%2F%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOMS%2Fforce-app%2Fmain%2Fdefault%2Fprofiles%2Fchat.json%22%2C%22path%22%3A%22%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOMS%2Fforce-app%2Fmain%2Fdefault%2Fprofiles%2Fchat.json%22%2C%22scheme%22%3A%22file%22%7D%2C%22pos%22%3A%7B%22line%22%3A1664%2C%22character%22%3A858%7D%7D%2C%7B%22uri%22%3A%7B%22%24mid%22%3A1%2C%22fsPath%22%3A%22%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOMS%2Fforce-app%2Fmain%2Fdefault%2Fprofiles%2Fchat.json%22%2C%22external%22%3A%22file%3A%2F%2F%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOMS%2Fforce-app%2Fmain%2Fdefault%2Fprofiles%2Fchat.json%22%2C%22path%22%3A%22%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOMS%2Fforce-app%2Fmain%2Fdefault%2Fprofiles%2Fchat.json%22%2C%22scheme%22%3A%22file%22%7D%2C%22pos%22%3A%7B%22line%22%3A1741%2C%22character%22%3A852%7D%7D%5D%5D [`NPI__c.field-meta.xml`](command:_github.copilot.openRelativePath?%5B%7B%22scheme%22%3A%22file%22%2C%22authority%22%3A%22%22%2C%22path%22%3A%22%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOMS%2Fforce-app%2Fmain%2Fdefault%2Fobjects%2FTreating_Physician_Information__c%2Ffields%2FNPI__c.field-meta.xml%22%2C%22query%22%3A%22%22%2C%22fragment%22%3A%22%22%7D%5D "/Users/thbui/Documents/Salesforce/OMS/force-app/main/default/objects/Treating_Physician_Information__c/fields/NPI__c.field-meta.xml") file. Here is how you can modify it:

```xml
<CustomField xmlns="http://soap.sforce.com/2006/04/metadata">
    <fullName>NPI__c</fullName>
    <label>NPI</label>
    <length>10</length>
    <type>Text</type>
</CustomField>
```

[`NPI__c`](command:_github.copilot.openSymbolFromReferences?%5B%22NPI__c%22%2C%5B%7B%22uri%22%3A%7B%22%24mid%22%3A1%2C%22fsPath%22%3A%22%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOMS%2Fchat.json%22%2C%22external%22%3A%22file%3A%2F%2F%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOMS%2Fchat.json%22%2C%22path%22%3A%22%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOMS%2Fchat.json%22%2C%22scheme%22%3A%22file%22%7D%2C%22pos%22%3A%7B%22line%22%3A1669%2C%22character%22%3A858%7D%7D%2C%7B%22uri%22%3A%7B%22%24mid%22%3A1%2C%22fsPath%22%3A%22%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOMS%2Fchat.json%22%2C%22external%22%3A%22file%3A%2F%2F%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOMS%2Fchat.json%22%2C%22path%22%3A%22%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOMS%2Fchat.json%22%2C%22scheme%22%3A%22file%22%7D%2C%22pos%22%3A%7B%22line%22%3A1746%2C%22character%22%3A852%7D%7D%2C%7B%22uri%22%3A%7B%22%24mid%22%3A1%2C%22fsPath%22%3A%22%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOMS%2Fforce-app%2Fmain%2Fdefault%2Fprofiles%2FAdmin.profile-meta.xml%22%2C%22external%22%3A%22file%3A%2F%2F%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOMS%2Fforce-app%2Fmain%2Fdefault%2Fprofiles%2FAdmin.profile-meta.xml%22%2C%22path%22%3A%22%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOMS%2Fforce-app%2Fmain%2Fdefault%2Fprofiles%2FAdmin.profile-meta.xml%22%2C%22scheme%22%3A%22file%22%7D%2C%22pos%22%3A%7B%22line%22%3A104%2C%22character%22%3A49%7D%7D%2C%7B%22uri%22%3A%7B%22%24mid%22%3A1%2C%22fsPath%22%3A%22%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOMS%2Fforce-app%2Fmain%2Fdefault%2Fprofiles%2FAdmin.profile-meta.xml%22%2C%22external%22%3A%22file%3A%2F%2F%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOMS%2Fforce-app%2Fmain%2Fdefault%2Fprofiles%2FAdmin.profile-meta.xml%22%2C%22path%22%3A%22%2FUsers%2Fthbui%2FDocuments%2FSalesforce%2FOMS%2Fforce-app%2Fmain%2Fdefault%2Fprofiles%2FAdmin.profile-meta.xml%22%2C%22scheme%22%3A%22file%22%7D%2C%22pos%22%3A%7B%22line%22%3A157%2C%22character%22%3A49%7D%7D%2C%7B%22uri%22%3A%7B%22%24m
